彼はきっと失敗する、十円の賭をしよう
I will bet 10 yen that he will fail.
どちらが勝つか賭をしよう
Let us lay a wager―make a bet―as to which wins.
白が勝つ、七三の賭をしよう
I will lay 7 to 3 that the white wins―lay 7 to 3 on the white.
四分六の賭をしよう
I will lay 4 to 6 on it.
賭をして勝つ

賭をして負ける
to lose a wager

content:

content.content: 日蔭で遊べ
Play in the shade.

I rested myself under the shade of a tree.
家があの木の蔭になって暗い
The tree shades the house―throws the house into the shade.
蔭になり日なたになって彼に尽した
I served my friend in all possible ways―in every possible way.
かげひなた〔蔭日向〕
おかげ〔お蔭〕

content:
』
〈前置詞相当〉(何の蔭に)behind (something)

content.content: 月が雲の蔭にかくれている
The moon is behind a cloud.
月が雲の蔭から現れる
The moon comes out from behind the clouds.
戸の蔭にかくれろ
Hide behind the door!
彼は戸の蔭から出て来た
He came out from behind the door.
敵が藪の蔭にかくれておった
The enemy were hiding behind some bushes.
船は島の蔭になって見えぬ
The ship is behind an island.
船が島の蔭にかくれて風をよけた
The ship lay under the lee of an island.
暴風雨に逢って島蔭に避難した
Overtaken by a storm, we took shelter under the lee of an island.
草葉の蔭で悦んでいるでしょう
He must be rejoicing under the sod―(に相当するは)―His soul will rest in peace.
僕がそんなことをしたら親父は草葉の蔭で悦ぶまい
If I do such a thing, I shall make my father turn in his grave.
事件の蔭に女がいる
There is a lady in the case.
蔭に黒幕がいる
There is a man behind the curtain.
蔭にまわる
to get behind the scenes
蔭にまわって見ると意外な事実があるものだ
I find strange facts behind the scenes.

content:
かげ〔陰〕
〈名〉One's absence

content.content: 陰で
in one's absence―behind one's back
陰で悪口を言う
to speak ill of one in one's absence―abuse one behind one's back―stab one in the back―backbite one―whisper against one
面前で賞める人に限って陰で悪口を言う
A man who praises you to your face, is sure to abuse you behind your back.
あの男は陰にまわっていたずらをする
He will do mischief behind our backs―on the sly.
陰で舌を出す
to thrust a tongue in one's cheek―laugh in one's sleeve
陰で舌を出しているだろう
He must be laughing in his sleeve.
(新校長が改革を始めると)陰で不平を言う者があった
Some people murmurred at his proceedings.
昨夜陰で君の噂をしたがクシャミが出なかったか
Were your ears burning last night?
陰に人がいる
There is a man behind the curtain.
陰ながら君の成功を祈っておった
I have been wishing you success in secret―in my heart.
陰ながら承知しておりました
I learned of it from other quarters.

content:
かげ〔影〕
〈名〉A shadow; an image

content.content: 白壁に影がさす
A shadows falls on the white wall.
月光が白壁に影をさす
The moon casts a shadow on the white wall.
障子に女の影がさした
The shadow of a girl fell on the paper screen.
噂すれば影がさす
“Talk of the devil, and he will appear.”
山の影が湖水に映る
The mountains are reflected in the lake―mirrored in the lake―imaged in the lake.
湖水に映った富士の影
the image of Mt. Fuji in the lake
快楽と苦痛は影の形にしたがうが如し
Pain goes along with pleasure as shadow goes along with light―Pleasure and pain are as inseparable as light and shade.
影をつかむ
to grasp at the shadow (and lose the substance)
影を追う
to chase a phantom
影をかくす
to conceal oneself
彼はあれからこっち影をかくした
I have lost sight of him ever since.
図に影をつける
to shade a drawing
彼は影が薄くなった
He has fallen into the shade.
彼は見る影も無い
He is a ruin―a wreck―the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was―the shadow of what he used to be.
軍国主義は地上にその影をとどめず
Militarism has disappeared off the face of the earth―vanished off the face of the earth―been wiped off the face of the earth.
堂々たる艦隊は海上にその影をとどめず
The vaunted Baltic squadron had disappeared off the face of the deep―been wiped off the face of the deep.
武力をもって世界を圧したる二大国は今や地上にその影を絶つ
The two mighty powers, which domineered over the world by their military power, have been wiped out of existence.
尋ねる家は影も形も無かった
The house I sought was clean gone.
もと繁昌した町は今は影も形も無い
Not a trace remains of the once-bustling town.

かけぬける〔駈け抜ける〕
〈他動〉To outrun; to outstrip

content.content: 彼は後から来て僕らを駈け抜けた
He has outrun us―outstripped us.

content:
かけね〔掛け値〕
〈名〉
1. An overcharge; a fictitious price; a fancy price

content.content: 掛け値をする
to overcharge one―ask a fictitious price―ask a fancy price
決してお掛け値は致しません
I am not overcharging you―I do not ask a fancy price.
掛け値の無いところいくらか
What is your lowest price?
手前どもでは掛け値を申さないことにきめております
We make it a rule to ask only one price―We never ask two prices.
現金掛け値なし
No credit and one price.

content: 2. (=誇大)exaggeration

content.content: あの人の話には掛け値がある
His stories must be taken with a grain of salt―taken with some grains of allowance.
掛け値のないところ、彼は大した学者じゃない
To tell the truth, he is not much of a scholar.

content:
かけねなし〔掛値なし〕
〈名〉One price
〈形、副〉(=に) without exaggeration:(=の) unexaggerated; true

content.content: 掛け値なし七分通りだ
It is true 70 percent.
掛け値無しの学者だ
He is a true scholar.
掛け値無しに言えば大した学者じゃない
To tell the truth, he is not much of a scholar.

かけばいばい〔掛け売買〕
〈名〉Dealing on credit:(=する) to deal on credit

content:
かけはし〔掛橋〕
〈名〉
1. (=橋)a bridge (over a chasm)
2. (=仲介)a medium; an intermediary

content.content: 鎖国の日本はオランダを掛橋として外界の事情を知った
The exclusive Japan learned about the outer world through the medium of the Dutch.
恋の掛橋
a go-between
恋の掛橋となる
to go between the lovers

content:
かけはなれる〔掛け離れる〕
〈自動〉To be far apart (from each other); to be different (from each other)

content.content: 彼のところと僕のところはだいぶかけ離れている
We live far apart from each other.
双方の主張が全然かけ離れている
There is a wide difference between their claims.
二人の文体はあまりかけ離れているから比較ができぬ
Their styles are so different from each other that there is no comparison between them.
二人の年齢があまりにかけ離れている
There is a disparity of age between the two.
彼の職は人格とあまりかけ離れている(柄に無い)
His office is foreign to his character―out of character.

content:
かけひ〔筧〕
〈名〉A water-pipe; a conduit; a flume

content.content: 筧で水を引く
to draw water through a conduit

content:
かけひき〔掛け引き〕
〈名〉
1. (=値段の掛引)bargaining:(=する) to bargain, chaffer, haggle, higgle (with some one about or over the price)

content.content: 値段のかけひきする
to bargain over the price―haggle and higgle (about the price)
君はかけひきが上手だ
You are a good hand at bargaining.
僕はかけひきが嫌いだから何でも言い値に買う
I hate bargaining. I always give the price asked.
一厘もかけひき無し
We ask only one price―Our goods are one-priced.
かけひきが強い
He is close at a bargain.

content: 2. (=外交術)diplomacy; finesse; tact; policy:(=する) to resort to diplomacy; to use finesse; to diplomatize

content.content: 彼はかけひきが巧みだ
He is a good diplomatist―a consummate diplomatist.
相手次第ではずいぶんかけひきも必要だ
With some people, we must resort to diplomacy.
その辺はかけひきがむつかしい
It requires tact.
あの人の話しにはかけひきがあって真意がわからぬ
There is so much finesse in what he says that there is no knowing what his real intentions are.
彼のすることはかけひきがある
His actions are dictated by policy.

content: 3. (=戦略)strategy; tactics; manoeuvres

content.content: 議場のかけひきにかけては彼に及ぶ者が無い
No one can compare with him in parliamentary tactics―parliamentary manoeuvring.
彼は議場のかけひきに長じている
He is a parliamentary tactician.

content:
かげひなた〔蔭日向〕
〈名〉Duplicity; double-dealing:(奉公人なら)eye-service

content.content: あの人は蔭日なたがある
He is a double-dealer―double-hearted―double-faced―playing a double game.
蔭日なたが無い
He is single-hearted―single-minded―honest.
蔭日なたのある奉公人だ
He is an eye-servant―He does eye-service.
蔭日なたの無い奉公人だ
He is a faithful servant―a trusty servant.
蔭日なた無く主人に仕えよ
Serve your master faithfully―Be faithful in your master's service.

かけぶとん〔掛蒲団〕
〈名〉A coverlet; a counterpane; a quilt

content:
かげべんけい〔陰弁慶〕
〈名〉A braggart

content.content: あの男は陰弁慶だ
He is a lion at home―invincible in peace, invisible in war.

content:
かげぼうし〔影法師〕
〈名〉A shadow

content.content: 障子に影法師が映る
A shadow falls on the paper-screen.

content:
かげぼし〔蔭干し〕
〈名〉Drying in the shade

content.content: 蔭干しにする
to dry anything in the shade

かげま〔孌童〕
〈名〉A professional catamite

かけまくも〔掛巻くも〕
〈副〉In the mentioning of it

content:
かけまわる〔駈け廻る〕
〈自動〉To run about; to hurry about; to bustle about

content.content: 彼は朝飯も食わずして駈けまわる
He will not let the grass grow under his feet.

content:
かげみにそう〔影身に添う〕
〈熟語〉To keep close to (one)

content.content: 幼君の影身に添って守護し奉らん
I will follow my young lord like a shadow to watch over him.

かげむしゃ〔影武者〕
〈名〉A general's double; a dummy general

content:
かけめ〔掛け目〕
〈名〉Weight

content.content: 掛け目が一斤余足りない
The weight is short by over a pound.

content:
かけもち〔掛け持ち〕
〈名〉Holding two or more different offices; attending to two or more different duties:(=する) to hold two or more offices; to attend to two or more duties

content.content: あの先生は学校を五つもかけ持ちしている
He teaches at five different schools.
彼は会社の重役を六つもかけ持ちしている
He is the director of six different companies.
大学教授のかけ持ちは禁ずるがよろし
University professors ought to be forbidden to lecture elsewhere.
かけ持ちにあの学校へ行くのだ
I teach at that school as an additional duty.

content:
かけもの〔掛け物〕
〈名〉A hanging-roll; a hanging-scroll; a hanging-picture

content.content: 床の間に雪舟の掛け物が掛かっている
In the alcove hangs a painting by Sesshu.

かけもの〔賭け物〕
〈名〉A wager; a stake

かけよる〔駈け寄る〕
〈自動〉To run up to (a man, etc.)

かけら〔欠片〕
〈名〉A fragment; a splinter; a broken piece

content:
かける〔掛ける、懸ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=吊り下げる)to hang

content.content: 看板を掛ける
to hang out a sign―put up a signboard
帽子を掛ける
to hang a hat
帽子を帽子掛けに掛ける
to hang a hat on the rack
幕を掛ける
to hang a curtain
窓に幕を掛ける
to hang a window with a curtain
手拭いを固く絞って掛けておけ
Wring your towel dry, and hang it up.
彼は自分の肖像を画かせてこれを会堂に掛けさせた
He caused his own portrait to be painted and hung in the hall.
羊頭を掛けて狗肉を売る
to cry mutton and sell dog―“show one bread and give one a stone”―impose upon the public

content: 2. (=被せる)to cover (one with anything); to put (one thing) over (another); to lay (one thing) on (another)

content.content: 蒲団をかける
to cover one with bedclothes
寒いからよく蒲団をかけてお休み
You must cover yourself up warm.
卓子に卓布をかける
to lay a cloth on the table―(第二構文が普通)―lay the table with cloth
顔にベールをかける
to put a veil over one's face

content: 3. (=もたせかける)to set (one thing) on or against (another)

content.content: 屋根に梯子を掛ける
to set up a ladder against the roof
卓上にひじをかける
to rest one's elbow on the table
人の膝に手をかける
to lay a hand on one's lap
水をかける
to throw water on anything―pour water on anything―sprinkle water on anything―splash one with water
火に水をかける
to throw water on the flames
身体に水をかける
to pour water one oneself―rinse oneself
彼の頭に桶で水をかけてやった
I dashed a bucket of water over his head.
店の小僧に水をかけられた
A shop-boy splashed me with water.
花に水をかける
to water the flowers
油に火のついた時は水をかけても駄目だ
It is no use throwing water on burning oil.
油をかける
to pour oil on the fire―set one on
魚に塩をかける
to sprinkle salt on fish―(第二構文が普通)―sprinkle fish with salt
火をかける
to set fire to a building
火に灰をかける
to bank a fire
腰をかける
to sit―sit down―seat oneself―be seated
彼は椅子にかけている
He is sitting in a chair―sitting on a chair―seated in a chair.
おかけなさい
Please sit down―Please be seated―Please take a chair.
彼は僕のそばにかけた
He sat down―seated himself―by me.
どっかと椅子に腰をかけた
He sank into a chair.
眼鏡をかける
to wear spectacles
彼は眼鏡をかけて手紙を読んだ
He put on his spectacles, and read the letter.
彼は金縁の眼鏡をかけている
He is wearing gold-rimmed spectacles―He has gold-rimmed spectacles on―He is in gold-rimmed spectacles.
眼鏡をかけて読書している
He is reading with spectacles on―in spectacles.
胸に時計をかけている
He wears a watch on his breast.
胸に勲章をかけている
He wears a decoration on his breast.
橋をかける
to build a bridge over a river―throw a bridge across a river―bridge a river
河に橋がかけてある
There is a bridge over the river―There is a bridge across the river―A bridge is built over the river―A bridge is thrown across the river―A bridge spans the river―The river is bridged.
桟橋をかける
to throw out a pier
鉄道をかける
to lay a railway
電線をかける
to lay a line
網をかける
to set a net
網をかけて待つ
to set a net for one's victim
係蹄{わな}をかける
to set a trap―lay a snare
係蹄をかけて待つ
to set a trap―lay a snare―for one's victim
罪人に縄を掛ける
to bind a criminal―put a criminal in bonds
彼は縄を掛けて護送された
He was sent to prison in bonds.
あれは親の首に縄を掛ける奴だ
He will involve his own father in crime.
錠を掛ける
to lock the door
掛け金を掛ける
to latch the door
戸に錠が掛けてある
The door is locked―on the lock.
錠が掛けてない
The door is not locked―off the lock.
掛け金だけ掛けてある
The door is latched―on the latch.
掛け金も掛けてない
The door is not latched―off the latch.
鍋を火にかける
to put a pot over the fire
この土瓶は火にかけて大丈夫か
Will this pot stand the fire?―Can I put the pot over the fire?
火にかけると匂いが抜ける
Show it the fire, and the smell will go off.
目方を掛ける
to weigh anything
この手紙を掛けてみて下さい
Please weigh this letter.
秤に掛ける
to weigh anything in the balance
税をかける
to lay a tax on―impose a tax on―levy a tax on―anything
贅沢品には重い税をかけるがよい
Heavy taxes ought to be imposed on articles of luxury.
金をかける
to spend money on anything
あの人は着物に金をかける
He spends much money on his clothes.
彼は多大な金をかけて息子に修行をさせた
He spent a great sum of money on his son's education―He educated his son at great expense.
今度の普請にはだいぶかけたろう
He must have spent a great deal on his new house―His new house must have cost a great deal.
彼は一万円かけて普請をした
He spent 10,000 yen on his new house―He built his house at a cost of 10,000 yen.
彼は商売道具に金をかける
He lays out much money on his stock-in-trade.
軍艦は巨大な金をかけて造る
Warships are built at enormous costs.
時間をかける
to give time to―devote time to―anything
時間をかけたならできないこともあるまい
It might be done if enough time were given to it.
人数をかける
to put men to the work
職人を十人もかけたら一日にできよう
The work might be done in one day if ten men were put to it―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Ten men will do the work in one day.
問をかける
to put a question to one
謎をかける
to put a puzzle to one―propose a riddle to one
君に一つ謎をかけよう
I will give you a puzzle to guess.
暗に謎をかける
to drop a hint―let fall a hint―throw out a hint
かまをかける
to surprise one into confession
かまをかけられて言ってしまった
I was surprised into confession.
電信をかける
to telegraph to one―wire one a message―telegraph one a message
その節はそのように電報をかけて下さい
In that case, you will wire me to that effect.
電話をかける
to telephone to one―phone to one―call one up (to the telephone)―ring one up (on the telephone)
電話をかけたいのです
I wish to use the telephone.
何番へおかけになりますか
What number do you want to ring up?
いくら電話をかけても通じない
I rang him up several times, but there was no reply―I could not get him on the telephone.
声をかける
to shout to one―call to one
彼に声をかけて危険を警戒した
I shouted to him to warn him of the danger.
車夫に声をかけて止まれと言った
I called to the jinrikishaman to stop.
言葉をかける
to accost one
話しかける
to speak to one―address one
心配をかける
to give one anxiety―cause one anxiety―occasion one anxiety
ご心配をかけてすみません
I am sorry to have caused you anxiety.
帰りが遅いので心配をかけてはと思って急いで帰って来た
I returned in haste, lest I should occasion you anxiety at my long absence.
手数をかける
to give one trouble―cause one trouble―occasion one trouble
ご面倒をかけてすみません
I am sorry to give you trouble―put you to trouble.
迷惑をかける
to cause one inconvenience―put one to inconvenience
ご迷惑をかけてすみません
Excuse me for inconveniencing you!
苦労をかける
to give one trouble
お前には苦労をかけた
I have led you a hard life―led you a dog's life of it.
それは親に苦労をかけた罰だ
That is a judgment for bringing your father's gray hairs to the grave.
思いをかける
(男が女に)to love―fall in love with―a girl―(女が男に)―fix her affections on a man
情けをかける
(不幸な人に対してなら)to take pity on the unfortunate―take compassion on the unfortunate―(罪人に対してなら)―have mercy on a sinner―(男女間なら)―love a man or a woman.
目をかける
to show one kindness―be kind to one
可哀そうな子だから目をかけておやりなさい
Be kind to the poor child!
心にかける
to keep anything in mind―bear anything in mind
気にかける
to take anything to heart―lay anything to heart
彼は失敗したのをたいそう気にかけている
He takes his failure seriously (to heart).
なに些細なことだ、気にかけることはない
Why, it is a trifle, Never mind!
手にかける
to handle―manage―deal with―a person or thing
こんな病気を手にかけたのは初めてだと医者が言う
The doctor says he never handled such a case before.
彼は支那の学生を手にかけたことがある
He has experience with Chinese students.
手にかけて殺す
to kill a man with one's own hand
大工の手にかけりゃ造作も無いことだ
It will be an easy task for a carpenter.
病人を医者にかける
to place an invalid under the care of a physician―place an invalid under medical treatment―commit an invalid to a doctor's care
医者にもかけてみたがどうもはかばかしくない
We have called in the doctor, but the invalid is not doing well.
もう医者にかけても駄目だ
It is no use sending for the doctor now―He is past medical aid.
六に四を掛ける
to multiply six by four
電気をかける
to electrify anything―charge anything with electricity
時計をかける
to wind up a watch
機械をかける
to set a machine going
願をかける
to put up a prayer―prefer a petition
お目にかけましょう
I will show it you―submit it to your inspection.
鼻にかける
to be proud of anything
彼は好男子を鼻にかけている
He is vain of his good looks.
よりをかける
to give a string a firmer twist
腕によりをかけて探してみよう
I will do my utmost―strain every nerve―to find such a man.
洋服に brush をかける
to brush a coat
ペテンにかける
to swindle a man
ペテンにかけて金を取る
to swindle a man out of his money―swindle money out of a man
掛け金を掛ける
to pay one's monthly instalment
口をかける
to call a geisha―offer one a position
あんな者は歯牙にかけぬ
I take no account of such men―Such men are beneath my notice.
馬の蹄にかけられる
to be kicked by a horse
賞を懸ける
to offer a reward
牝牛に牡牛をかけた
to put a bull to a cow―put a cow to a bull→『かけては〔掛けては〕』

content:
24. 
〈接尾動詞〉(何をしかける)to begin (doing something)

content.content: この本を読みかけている
I have begun reading this book.
英語がわかりかけて来た
I begin to understand English better.
人が死にかけている
The man is dying―He lies at the point of death.
花が開きかけている
The flowers are opening.
手紙を書きかけている
I am going to write a letter.

火にかけると匂いが抜ける
Show it the fire, and the smell will go off.
目方を掛ける
to weigh anything
この手紙を掛けてみて下さい
Please weigh this letter.
秤に掛ける
to weigh anything in the balance
税をかける
to lay a tax on―impose a tax on―levy a tax on―anything
贅沢品には重い税をかけるがよい
Heavy taxes ought to be imposed on articles of luxury.
金をかける
to spend money on anything
あの人は着物に金をかける
He spends much money on his clothes.
彼は多大な金をかけて息子に修行をさせた
He spent a great sum of money on his son's education―He educated his son at great expense.
今度の普請にはだいぶかけたろう
He must have spent a great deal on his new house―His new house must have cost a great deal.
彼は一万円かけて普請をした
He spent 10,000 yen on his new house―He built his house at a cost of 10,000 yen.
彼は商売道具に金をかける
He lays out much money on his stock-in-trade.
軍艦は巨大な金をかけて造る
Warships are built at enormous costs.
時間をかける
to give time to―devote time to―anything
時間をかけたならできないこともあるまい
It might be done if enough time were given to it.
人数をかける
to put men to the work
職人を十人もかけたら一日にできよう
The work might be done in one day if ten men were put to it―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Ten men will do the work in one day.
問をかける
to put a question to one
謎をかける
to put a puzzle to one―propose a riddle to one
君に一つ謎をかけよう
I will give you a puzzle to guess.
暗に謎をかける
to drop a hint―let fall a hint―throw out a hint
かまをかける
to surprise one into confession
かまをかけられて言ってしまった
I was surprised into confession.
電信をかける
to telegraph to one―wire one a message―telegraph one a message
その節はそのように電報をかけて下さい
In that case, you will wire me to that effect.
電話をかける
to telephone to one―phone to one―call one up (to the telephone)―ring one up (on the telephone)
電話をかけたいのです
I wish to use the telephone.
何番へおかけになりますか
What number do you want to ring up?
いくら電話をかけても通じない
I rang him up several times, but there was no reply―I could not get him on the telephone.
声をかける
to shout to one―call to one
彼に声をかけて危険を警戒した
I shouted to him to warn him of the danger.
車夫に声をかけて止まれと言った
I called to the jinrikishaman to stop.
言葉をかける
to accost one
話しかける
to speak to one―address one
心配をかける
to give one anxiety―cause one anxiety―occasion one anxiety
ご心配をかけてすみません
I am sorry to have caused you anxiety.
帰りが遅いので心配をかけてはと思って急いで帰って来た
I returned in haste, lest I should occasion you anxiety at my long absence.
手数をかける
to give one trouble―cause one trouble―occasion one trouble
ご面倒をかけてすみません
I am sorry to give you trouble―put you to trouble.
迷惑をかける
to cause one inconvenience―put one to inconvenience
ご迷惑をかけてすみません
Excuse me for inconveniencing you!
苦労をかける
to give one trouble
お前には苦労をかけた
I have led you a hard life―led you a dog's life of it.
それは親に苦労をかけた罰だ
That is a judgment for bringing your father's gray hairs to the grave.
思いをかける
(男が女に)to love―fall in love with―a girl―(女が男に)―fix her affections on a man
情けをかける
(不幸な人に対してなら)to take pity on the unfortunate―take compassion on the unfortunate―(罪人に対してなら)―have mercy on a sinner―(男女間なら)―love a man or a woman.
目をかける
to show one kindness―be kind to one
可哀そうな子だから目をかけておやりなさい
Be kind to the poor child!
心にかける
to keep anything in mind―bear anything in mind
気にかける
to take anything to heart―lay anything to heart
彼は失敗したのをたいそう気にかけている
He takes his failure seriously (to heart).
なに些細なことだ、気にかけることはない
Why, it is a trifle, Never mind!
手にかける
to handle―manage―deal with―a person or thing
こんな病気を手にかけたのは初めてだと医者が言う
The doctor says he never handled such a case before.
彼は支那の学生を手にかけたことがある
He has experience with Chinese students.
手にかけて殺す
to kill a man with one's own hand
大工の手にかけりゃ造作も無いことだ
It will be an easy task for a carpenter.
病人を医者にかける
to place an invalid under the care of a physician―place an invalid under medical treatment―commit an invalid to a doctor's care
医者にもかけてみたがどうもはかばかしくない
We have called in the doctor, but the invalid is not doing well.
もう医者にかけても駄目だ
It is no use sending for the doctor now―He is past medical aid.
六に四を掛ける
to multiply six by four
電気をかける
to electrify anything―charge anything with electricity
時計をかける
to wind up a watch
機械をかける
to set a machine going
願をかける
to put up a prayer―prefer a petition
お目にかけましょう
I will show it you―submit it to your inspection.
鼻にかける
to be proud of anything
彼は好男子を鼻にかけている
He is vain of his good looks.
よりをかける
to give a string a firmer twist
腕によりをかけて探してみよう
I will do my utmost―strain every nerve―to find such a man.
洋服に brush をかける
to brush a coat
ペテンにかける
to swindle a man
ペテンにかけて金を取る
to swindle a man out of his money―swindle money out of a man
掛け金を掛ける
to pay one's monthly instalment
口をかける
to call a geisha―offer one a position
あんな者は歯牙にかけぬ
I take no account of such men―Such men are beneath my notice.
馬の蹄にかけられる
to be kicked by a horse
賞を懸ける
to offer a reward
牝牛に牡牛をかけた
to put a bull to a cow―put a cow to a bull→『かけては〔掛けては〕』

content:
24. 
〈接尾動詞〉(何をしかける)to begin (doing something)

content.content: この本を読みかけている
I have begun reading this book.
英語がわかりかけて来た
I begin to understand English better.
人が死にかけている
The man is dying―He lies at the point of death.
花が開きかけている
The flowers are opening.
手紙を書きかけている
I am going to write a letter.

content:
かける〔駈ける〕
〈自動〉To run:(馬なら)to gallop

content.content: 彼は駈けて行った
He went running―went at a run.
馬を駈けらす
to gallop a horse―set a horse galloping

content:
かける〔欠ける〕
〈自動〉
1. (=一部分こわれる)to break (off); to be broken (off)

content.content: 歯が欠ける
A tooth breaks.
老人は歯が欠けた
The old man has lost his teeth.
歯が皆欠けてしまった
His teeth are all gone.
茶碗が欠けた
The edge of the tea-cup is broken off.
小刀の刃が欠けた
The edge of the knife is nicked―The knife has a nicked edge.

content: 2. (=欠損する)to lack; to be wanting (in something); to fail (in something)

content.content: 皆で十冊あるのだから一冊欠けている
There ought to be ten volumes in all, so one is wanting.
お前は注意が欠けている
You are wanting in care.
それでは役目が欠けます
Then I shall fail in my duty.
(一つ離して売ると)組が欠けて端物になります
Then I shall break the set.
百円に三銭欠ける
It is 100 yen minus three sen―100 yen less three sen―3 sen short of 100 yen.
百円に一円欠けても売りません
I will not take anything short of 100 yen.
兄弟十人一人も欠けずに成人した
The ten brothers grew up, every one of them.

content: 3. (=怠る)to be negligent (of anything); to be remiss (in anything)

content.content: 職務に欠ける
to be negligent of one's duties―remiss in one's duties
道に欠ける
to be wrong
道に欠けたことをする
to do wrong

content:
かける〔書ける〕
〈自動〉To write well

content.content: その万年筆は書けるか
Does the fountain-pen write well?
書けるかどうか書いてみ給え
See how it writes.

content: 〈他動〉To be able to write

content.content: 君は英文で手紙が書けるか
Can you write a letter in English?
(本は読めるだろうが)手紙一本満足に書けない
He may be a scholar, but he can not write a decent letter.

content:
かける〔賭ける〕
〈他動〉To bet (money on a horse); to stake (one's life on the result)

content.content: 競馬に百円賭けよう
I will bet 100 yen on the horse.
首を賭けてもよし
I will stake my head on the result.
一国の存亡を賭けた戦争であった
The national existence was staked on the war.
命を賭けてもよい
I will stake my life on it.
命を賭けても彼を助ける
I will save him at the risk of my life.
金を賭けて勝負事をする、金を賭けずに勝負事をする
to play for money―play for love

content:
かける〔翔ける〕
〈自動〉To soar

content.content: 鷲が空を翔ける
An eagle soars into the sky.

content:
かける〔虧ける〕
〈自動〉To wane

content.content: 月が満ちてかける
The moon waxes and wanes.
月が今かけている
The moon is on the wane.
満つればかくる世の習
“Every flood has its ebb.”

content:
かげる〔蔭る〕
〈自動〉To be obscured

content.content: 日が蔭る
The sun is obscured.
月が蔭る
The moon gets behind a cloud.

かげろう〔蜉蝣〕
〈名〉The ephemera; the day-fly

content:
かけん〔家憲〕
〈名〉The constitution of a family

content.content: 家憲を定める
to establish a family constitution
家憲を破る
to violate the family constitution

content:
かげん〔下弦〕
〈名〉The last quarter (of the moon)

content.content: 下弦の月
the waning moon

content:
かげん〔加減〕
〈名〉
1. (=算術の加減)addition and subtraction

content.content: 加減乗除
addition, subtraction, multiplication and division―the four rules of arithmetic

content: 2. (=斟酌)allowance:(=する) to allow for, make allowance for (the wind, etc.)

content.content: 風の加減をして的を狙う
to allow for the wind
(彼我両艦の)速力を加減して敵艦を狙う
to allow for speed
あの人の話は加減して聞かなければならぬ
His stories must be taken with a grain of salt―taken with some grains of allowance.

content: 3. (=塩梅)seasoning; cooking; taste:(=する) to season

content.content: 塩加減する
to salt the soup to taste
汁の加減はどうか、塩加減は好いか
How is the soup?―Is the soup well seasoned?
加減を見て下さい
Please taste the soup.
加減がよろしい
The soup is well seasoned.
肉はちょうど好い加減に煮えている
The meat is well cooked.
肉はちょうど好い加減に焼けている
The meat is done to a turn.

content: 4. (=程合い)adjustment:(=する) to adjust

content.content: 風呂の加減をする
to adjust the temperature of the bath
お風呂の加減はいかがですか
How is the bath?
ちょうど好い加減だ
The bath is to my liking.

content: 5. (=程度)degree; how?

content.content: そのむつかしさ加減はやってみなけりゃわからない
You can't see how difficult it is, unless you try it for yourself.
その面白さ加減は見なけりゃわからない
You can form no idea of how amusing it is, unless you see for yourself.
そのばかばかしさ加減たらない
Oh! it is so absurd.
いいかげん〔好い加減〕
何事も加減してするものだ
You shall not go too far―not go beyond bounds―in everything―You should keep within bounds―use moderation―be moderate.
勉強も加減してするがよい
You should work in moderation―be moderate in working.

content: 7. (=健康)health

content.content: 今日はお加減どうですか
How do you find yourself this morning?
ちと加減が悪い
I am a little indisposed.

content: 8. (=陽気の加減)influence (of the weather)

content.content: そりゃ陽気の加減だろう(陽気あたり)
You must be under the weather.
戸の締まらないのは陽気の加減だ
The door shuts hard owing to the weather―It is due to the weather.

かげん〔嘉言〕
〈名〉A good saying

content:
かげん〔寡言〕
〈名〉Taciturnity:(=の) taciturn

content.content: 寡言の人だ
He is a taciturn man―a man of few words.

content:
かげん〔過言〕
〈名〉
1. (=失言)a slip of the tongue
2. (=誇大な言)an exaggeration

content.content: 世界第一と言うもあえて過言にあらず
It is no exaggeration to say―not too much to say―that it is the first on earth.

かげん〔訛言〕
〈名〉A false report; a groundless rumour; a canard

がげん〔雅言〕
〈名〉Elegant phraseology; literary diction; classical language

かげんじょうじょ〔加減乗除〕
〈名〉Addition, subtraction, multiplication and division; the four rules of arithmetic

content:
かこ〔過去〕
〈名〉
1. The past:(=の) past; bygone

content.content: 過去を追想する
to look back on the past
過去を追慕する
to look back to the past―look on the past with regret
過去をうかがい将来を察する
We look into the past and glance into the future―read the future in the past.
過去にありし出来事
events in the past―past events
過去のこととはなりぬ、事は過去に属す
It is a thing of the past.
過去のことは取り返しがつかぬ
We can not undo the past.
過去の罪滅しをする
to atone for the past―unlive the past
過去十年間この事業に従事している
I have been engaged in this work during the past ten years―for the last ten years.
法律は過去にさかのぼらず
The law is not retrospective.
過去にさかのぼる法律
a retrospective law
過去帳
the death register of a family

content:
2. (=前世)a previous life; a previous existence
3. (=動詞の過去)the past tense; the preterit

content.content: 過去完了
the past perfect tense
過去分詞
the past participle

content:
かご〔加護〕
〈名〉Divine protection

content.content: 弓矢八幡のご加護によって助かった
He escaped by the protection of the God of War.
神仏のご加護を受けている
I am under the protection of the gods.

content:
かご〔駕籠〕
〈名〉A palanquin; a sedan-chair

content.content: 駕籠に乗る
to ride in a sedan-chair
駕籠で山を越す
to cross a mountain in a sedan-chair
駕籠かき
a palanquin-bearer
駕籠渡し
a rope-bridge crossed in a basket

content:
かご〔籠〕
〈名〉A cage

content.content: 鳥を籠に入れる
to put a bird in a cage
籠の鳥
a bird in a cage―a caged bird
籠の鳥を放す
to let the bird out of the cage―set a bird free

content:
かご〔籃〕
〈名〉A basket; a hamper

content.content: 一籃の果物
a basket of fruit
鮮魚一籃
a hamper of fish
籃を作る
to make baskets―weave baskets
籃細工
basketry

content:
かこい〔囲い〕
〈名〉
1. An enclosure

content.content: 囲いをする
to enclose a space
庭に囲いをする
to enclose a garden with a fence―fence round the garden―fence in the garden
囲い内
an enclosure―a close

content: 2. (=茶寮)a tea-pavilion

かこいもの〔囲い者〕
〈名〉A kept woman; a kept mistress

content.content: 囲い者をする
to keep a separate establishment

content:
かこう〔囲う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=囲いする)to enclose (a space)
2. (=囲い者をする)to keep (a mistress)
3. (=貯蔵する)to store; to preserve; to keep

content.content: リンゴを囲う
to keep apples over the winter
大根や人参を囲う
to keep vegetables for the winter
雪を囲う
to keep snow for the summer

content:
かこう〔下降〕
〈名〉Descent; a fall:(=する) to descend; to fall; to drop; to go down; to come down

content.content: 温度は零度に下降した
The thermometer fell to 0°

content:
かこう〔佳肴〕
〈名〉Delicacies; dainties; rare dishes

content.content: 佳肴に飽く
to be satiated with delicacies
美酒佳肴
high living

content:
かこう〔加工〕
〈名〉Improvement (on natural products):(=する) to improve on (natural products); to work up (materials)

content.content: 加工紙
art paper

かこう〔河口〕
〈名〉The mouth of a river; an estuary

かこう〔河港〕
〈名〉A river port

content:

〈名〉A crater

content.content: 火口湖
a crater-lake

content:
かごう〔化合〕
〈名〉Chemical combination:(=する) to combine (with something)

content.content: 水素は酸素と化合して水となる
Hydrogen combines with oxygen to form water.
化合物
a (chemical) compound
化合力
chemical affinity
化合量
the combining weight

〈名〉A palanquin-bearer

content:
かこく〔苛酷〕
〈形〉Cruel (treatment); severe (punishment); rigorous (law); hard (measures); harsh (criticism)

content.content: 過酷な取扱いを受けた
I received cruel treatment.
過酷な罰を受けた
I was severely punished.
過酷な処置をする
to take hard measures
この法律は苛酷だ

この評はちと過酷だ
The criticism is rather harsh.

かこちがお〔託ち顔〕

content:
かこつ〔託つ〕

content.content: 身の不幸をかこつ
to repine at one's misfortune―curse the day of one's birth

content:
かこつけ〔託け〕
〈名〉A pretence; a pretext; a plea:(=る) to pretend to be (ill); to make a pretence of, make a pretext of, make a plea of (illness)

content.content: 病にかこつけて

under pretence of illness―on the pretence of illness―under pretext of illness―on the pretext of illness―under plea of illness―on the plea of illness―under colour of illness―under cover of illness―under the cloak of illness―under the mask of illness
彼は病にかこつけて面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me under plea of illness.
彼はなにかしらにかこつけて学校を休む
He absents himself from school on some pretext or other.
親切にかこつけて僕をだました
He cheated me under colour of friendship―under the mask of friendship.
伝道にかこつけて国を取る
to conquer a country under cover of religion―under the mask of religion―under the cloak of religion―under the veil of religion

content:
かこみ〔囲み〕
〈名〉A siege; an investment; a beleaguerment

content.content: 囲みの内に陥る
to be besieged―be invested―be beleaguered
囲みを解く(また囲みを解かしむ)
to raise the siege
囲みを破る
to break through the besieging army―cut one's way through the besieging army

content:
かこむ〔囲む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=取り巻く)to surround; to encircle; to encompass; to enclose; to gird; to beset; to shut in

content.content: 日本は海に囲まれている
Japan is a sea-girt country.
家は木に囲まれている
The house is surrounded with trees.
城はまわし堀に囲まれている
The castle is encircled by moats―girt with moats.
家は煉瓦塀で囲んである
A brick wall surrounds the house―encircles the house.
町は山に囲まれている
The town is shut in by mountains.
家が森に囲まれている
The house is embosomed in a thicket.
船は氷に囲まれた
The ship was beset with ice―ice-bound.
我らは我が忠勇なる陸海軍に囲まれて安眠ができる
We can sleep in peace encompassed by our brave and faithful guards.
卓を囲む
to sit around the table

content: 2. (=攻囲する)to besiege, lay siege to (a castle); to invest (a fortress); to beleaguer (a city)

content.content: 城は蟻の這い出る隙も無く囲まれた
The castle was closely besieged―tightly invested.

content:
かごわたし〔駕籠渡し〕
〈名〉A rope-bridge crossed in a basket

content.content: 駕籠渡しを渡る
to cross a rope-bridge in a basket

content:
かこん〔禍根〕
〈名〉The source of calamity; the root of evil

content.content: 尚早の平和は禍根を将来に遺すおそれがある
Premature peace is apt to leave the source of future calamity.
禍根を絶つ
to strike at the root of the evil―lay the axe to the root of the evil

content:
かごん〔過言〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: かげん〔過言〕

content:
かさ〔笠〕
〈名〉
1. Head-gear; a hat:(編笠は)a straw-hat:(菅笠は)a sedge-hat

content.content: 笠をかぶる
to wear a hat
笠をかぶっている
He has a hat on―He is wearing a hat.
我が物と思えば軽し笠の雪
“A voluntary burden is no burden.”
我が物と
On my head-gear
思えば軽し
Without plaint I bear
笠の雪
My snowy load of care.
親の威光を笠に着る
to shelter oneself under one's father's influence
彼は親の威光を笠に着てわがままいっぱいやっている
He has everything his own way under the shelter of his father's influence.
人の威光を笠に着るものでない
One should stand on one's own merits.

火事はどこだ

火事はどの方角だ

ランプがこわれて火事になった

遠い火事だ

大した火事にもなるまい

火事はぼやで済んだ

〈名〉Excess; surplus; superfluity:(=の) excessive; surplus; superfluous

content.content: 過剰人口
surplus population
過剰支出
superfluous expenditure
生産過剰
excessive production―over-production
過剰金
a surplus sum

content:
がしょう〔賀正〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: がせい〔賀正〕

content:
がじょう〔賀状〕
〈名〉A congratulatory letter; a complimentary letter

content.content: 新年の賀状
a letter of New Year's greetings―a New Year's card

content:
かじょうがき〔箇条書き〕
〈名〉Articles; items; stipulations; conditions

content.content: 箇条書きにする
to itemize

かじょうはつじょう〔渦状発条〕
〈名〉A mainspring; a hair-spring

かしょく〔火食〕
〈名〉Cooked food:(=する) to eat cooked food; to live on cooked food

content:
かしょく〔貨殖〕
〈名〉Money-making

content.content: 彼は貨殖に汲々としている
He is bent on money-making.
貨殖の道に長じている
He is a good man of business.

かしょく〔過食〕
〈名〉Overeating; surfeit:(=する) to overeat oneself; to surfeit (oneself)

content:
かしょくのてん〔華燭の典〕
〈名〉A marriage ceremony; a wedding; nuptials

content.content: 華燭の典を挙げる
to celebrate a wedding―solemnize a marriage ceremony

content:
かしら〔か知ら〕
〈接尾動詞〉I wonder (if, whether, who, what, etc.) can

content.content: これが本当かしら
I wonder if it can be true―Can it be true?
僕にもできるかしら
I wonder if I can.
誰が来たかしら
I wonder who can have come.
何用かしら
I wonder what he can want.
どこへ行ったかしら
I wonder where he can have gone.
それはどういうわけかしら
I wonder how that can be.
僕の処置がどこが悪いかしらと思った
I wondered how I could have done wrong.

content:
かしら〔頭〕
〈名〉
1. (=あたま)the head

content.content: 恥じて頭を垂れる
to hang one's head for shame
お頭つき(の魚)
a whole fish

content: 2. (=首領)a chief; a leader; a boss:(殊に鳶の頭)a head-fireman

content.content: 人の頭に立つ
to stand a the head of men―be a leader (of men)―play first fiddle
彼は一方の頭と仰がれている
He is looked up as the leader of his set.
何でも頭になれば好い
One should be at the top of the tree.

かしらがき〔頭書き〕
〈名〉The top-notes (of a Japanese book)

content:
かしらじ〔頭字〕
〈名〉An initial (letter)

content.content: 姓名の頭地
one's initials

content:
かしらだつ〔頭立つ〕
〈自動〉To be at the head of men; to be a leader of men

content.content: 頭立つ者はどこか偉いところが無くてはならぬ
A leader of men must have something great about him.

content:
かしらだった〔頭立った〕
〈形〉Leading; principal; chief

content.content: 民衆の頭立った者を取抑えた
The leading men of the populace were arrested.

かしらもじ〔頭文字〕
〈名〉A capital (letter):(姓名などの頭文字は)initials

content:
かじりつく〔齧り付く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=喰い付く)to fasten one's teeth on (anything); to get one's teeth into (anything)

content.content: いったんかじりついたら最後ブルドッグのように放さぬ
Once he gets his teeth into anything, like a bull-dog, he will not let it go.

content: 2. (=取り付いて離れぬ)to cling to (one); to stick to (anything); to lock one's arms round (a person)

content.content: 女が男の首玉にかじりついた
She locked her arms round his neck.
互いにかじりついて離れぬ
They are locked in each other's arms.
河で助けようと思った人が僕の腕にかじりついて放さなかった
The drowning man clung fast to my arm.
こんな地位にかじりついていたってしょうがない
It is no use sticking to such a post.

content:
かじる〔齧る〕
〈他動〉
1. To gnaw; to nibble; to bite

content.content: 鼠が壁をかじる
The mouse gnaws the wall.
壁をかじって穴をあける
It will gnaw a hole through the wall.
縄をかじり切る
to gnaw through a rope
(人が)パンをかじる
to bite off a piece of bread―bite a piece out of bread
人の鼻をかじり取る
to bite a piece out of one's nose
鼠が何でもかじる
A mouse will gnaw (at) anything―bite pieces out of anything.
兎が木の皮をかじる
A hare nibbles the bark of trees.
親の脛をかじる
to depend on one's father―hang on one's father―live on one's father―sponge on one's father
まだ親の脛をかじっているのか
Are you still dependent on your father?
お前は親の脛をかじっている年じゃない
You are too old to be dependent on your father―old enough to be independent of your father.
生まかじりにかじる
to have a smattering of anything―know a bit of anything
彼は英語を少しかじっている
He has a smattering of English.
法律を少しかじっている
He is a bit of a lawyer.
何でも少しずつかじっている
He knows a bit of everything―He is a bit of everything.

かしわ〔黄鶏〕
〈名〉A brown hen

かしわ〔柏〕
〈名〉A kind of oak (with large leaves)

content:
かしわで〔柏手〕
〈名〉An open hand

content.content: 柏手を打つ
to clap hands (before a shrine)

content:
かしわもち〔柏餅〕
〈名〉Mochi wrapped in kashiwa-leaf

content.content: 柏餅になって寝る
to sleep rolled up in a single bed-cloth

content:
かしん〔佳辰〕
〈名〉An auspicious day

content.content: 元旦の佳辰を祝す
to celebrate the New Year's Day

かしん〔家信〕
〈名〉A letter from home

かしん〔家臣〕
〈名〉A retainer, a vassal, a liegeman (of a daimyo)

content:
かしん〔禍心〕
〈名〉An evil design; treacherous designs

content.content: 燐国の領土に対して禍心を包蔵する
to have designs on a neighbour's territory

content:
かしん〔花信〕
〈名〉Tidings of flowers

content.content: 墨堤(墨田川堤)の花信しきりに至る
Tidings of blossoms come in succession to entice me to the banks of the Sumida.

かしん〔花神〕
〈名〉The goddess of flowers; Flora

content:
かじん〔佳人〕
〈名〉A beautiful woman; a beauty:(集合的に言えば)beauty

content.content: 佳人薄命
Beautiful women are liable to misfortune.
都下の才子佳人の集まるところ
The place attracts the wit and beauty of the town.

かじん〔家人〕
〈名〉
1. (=家族)the family; one's people
2. (=家に住む人)the inmates of a house

content:
がじん〔佳人〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: かじん〔佳人〕

がじん〔雅人〕
〈名〉A man of taste

content:
がしんしょうたん〔臥薪嘗胆〕
〈熟語〉Brooding over one's wrongs

content.content: 臥薪嘗胆の思いをしている
He is brooding over one's wrongs.

かしんまひ〔下身麻痺〕
〈名〉Paraplegia

content:
かす〔糟〕
〈名〉Dregs, lees (of wine); grounds (of tea of coffee); draff (of beer-brewing); refuse (of anything, rejected as useless); scum (that rises to the surface in boiling or fermentation); sediment (that settles to the bottom); residuum (left after combustion or evaporation)

content.content: 酒の糟
sake lees
豆糟
bean-cake
締め糟
oil-cake
彼らは人間の糟だ
They are the dregs of the population―the scum of society.
糟をなめる
to imitate others―lack originality
選んで糟を取る(あまり択り好みするとかえって糟をつかむ)
“Go farther and fare worse.”

content:
かす〔貸す〕
〈他動〉
1. To lend (one something); to loan (one something); to advance (one a sum)

content.content: 金を貸す
to lend one money―accommodate one with a loan
この金を貸して下さらんか
Can't you lend me the money?―Can't you accommodate me?
彼は僕に金を貸せと言った
He asked me for a loan.
彼に金を貸せと言ったのは心を試してやったのだ
I asked him for a loan to put his friendship to the test.
二三円貸してくれんか
Will you lend me a few yen?―Can you spare me a few yen?―May I trouble you for a few yen?
利息を取って金を貸す
to lend money at interest
抵当を取って金を貸す
to lend money on security―lend money on mortgage
高利を貸す
to lend money on usury―practise usury
前金を貸す
to advance one a sum
月給の前金を五十円貸していただきたい
I wish to have 50 yen advanced on my salary.
手を貸す
to lend one a hand―lend one a helping hand
ちょっと手を貸してくれ
Lend me a hand!―Bear a hand!
力を貸す
to lend one assistance―give one a life
名を貸す
to lend one's name to a project
唐傘一本貸したのが縁の端
The loan of an umbrella led to their acquaintance.
耳を貸す
to give ear to anything
そんなつまらない話に耳を貸すものじゃない
You should not give ear to such idle tales.
ちょっとお耳を貸して下さい
A word in your ear!―A word with you!
ちょっとお顔を貸して下さい
Can you spare me five minutes?
ちょっと火を貸して下さい
Please give me a light―oblige me with a light.
電話を貸して下さい
May I use your telephone?

content: 3. (=賃貸しする)to let, rent (a house); to lease (land); to let (a room) on hire; to hire out, let out (carriages or boats)

content.content: 馬車を貸す
to hire out carriages―let out carriages
舟を貸す
to hire out boats―let out boats
ここに舟を貸すところがあるか
Are there boats to let out here?
家を貸す
to let a house―rent a house
この家は貸すのです
This house is to let.
この家は月百円で貸す
This house lets for 100 yen a month.
間を貸す
to let a room on hire―rent a room
この集会所は貸します
The hall is let on hire.
あの集会所は一日いくらで貸す
The hall can be hired by the day.
馬を貸す
to hire out horses
ここに馬を貸すところがあるか
Are there any horses for hire here?

content: 4. (=信用貸しする)to give (one) credit (for so much); to trust (one for some goods)

content.content: それでは一万円だけ無抵当で貸して下さい
You will give me credit for 10,000 yen.
この品を二三日貸してくれますか
Will you trust me for these goods for a few days?

content:
かず〔数〕
〈名〉A number; a figure

content.content: 数を数える
to count the number―tell the number
遊星の数は八つある
The planets are eight in number.
生徒の数は五千ある
The students number 5,000.
生徒の数はざっと五千とみてよかろう
The number of students may be roughly put at 5,000.
これは数あるうちの一例に過ぎぬ
This is only one instance out of many.
数が多い
There are many―a great many―They are numerous.
東京には学校の数が多い
The are many schools in Tokyo.
あの学校は生徒の数が多い
That school has a large number of students―numerous students.
数が少ない
There are few―They are few in number.
大学の数が少ない
There are few universities.
あの学校は生徒の数が少ない
That school has few students―only a few students.
数が増える、数が減る
to increase in number―decrease in number
数を増やす、数を減らす
to increase the number―decrease the number
数を加える
to add one number to another―add up figures
数限り無し
They are countless―numberless―innumerable.
僕もその数に入っている
I am (one) of the number.
五十人及第して僕もその数に入っている
Fifty have passed, myself among the rest.
日本は一等国の数に入っている
Japan is one of the first-rate powers―among the first-rate powers.
亡き人の数に入る
to go over to the majority―join the majority
吾々は物の数に入らぬ
We count for nothing.
物の数に入らぬ人だ
He is a nobody―a nullity―a nonentity―a cipher―a negligible quantity.
数ならぬ身
I am a humble individual.

content:
がす〔瓦斯<ガス>〕
〈名〉Gas

content.content: ガスをつける
to light the gas―turn on the gas
ガスを消す
to turn off the gas
ガスが出ている
The gas is on.
ガスが止まっている
The gas is off.
ガスが漏れる
The gas escapes.
このつぎ目はガスが漏らぬ
The joint is gas-tight.
教室はガスか電灯か
Are the class-rooms lighted by gas or by electricity?
ガスを引く(装置する)
to lay on gas―gas a house
(貸家広告)ガス装置あり
Gas laid on.
ガス装置
gas-fixture
ガス灯
a gas-light―a gas-lamp
露出ガス灯
a gas-jet
ガス・メートル
a gas-meter
ガス使用料
gas charge
ガス・ストーブ
a gas-stove
ガス管
a gas-pipe
ガス器具
gas-fittings
ガス・マントル
a gas-mantle
ガス灯のホヤ
a gas-globe
ガスの火口
a gas-burner
ガス発動機
a gas-motor
ガス炉
a gas-ring
(天井から下げる)ガス灯架
a gaselier
ガスだめ
a gas-tank
ガス製造所
a gas-works
ガス会社
a gas company

〈名〉Gas

content.content: ガスをつける
to light the gas―turn on the gas
ガスを消す

ガスが出ている

ガスが止まっている

to lay on gas―gas a house
(貸家広告)ガス装置あり

gas-fixture

a gas-light―a gas-lamp

ガス使用料

a gas-globe

かすい〔仮睡〕
〈名〉A nap; a doze:(=する) to take a nap; to doze; to fall into a doze; to drop off into a doze

がすいと〔瓦斯糸<ガス糸>〕
〈名〉Gassed yarn

がすいと〔瓦斯糸<ガス糸>〕
〈名〉Gassed yarn

content:
かすか〔微か〕
〈形〉
1. (=ほのか)faint; dim; indistinct:(=に) faintly; dimly; indistinctly

content.content: 鐘の音がかすかに聞こえる
The sound of a bell is faintly heard.
島がかすかに見える
An island is dimly seen.
かすかな声でそう言った
He said so in a faint voice.
かすかに記憶している
I have a faint recollection―a dim recollection―an indistinct recollection.
かすかな光
a glimmering light―a glimmer
灯火が遠方にかすかに見える
A light glimmers in the distance.

content:
2. (=憐むべき)miserable; wretched
3. (=僅少)scanty

かすがい〔鎹〕
〈名〉A clamp; a cramp

content.content: 材木をかすがいでとめる
to clamp two pieces of timber
子どもは夫婦のかすがい
A child is the pledge of affection.
彼は意見をしても豆腐にかすがい
Advice to him is water on a duck's back―Advice slides off him as water off a duck's back.

かずかぎりなき〔数限り無き〕
〈形〉Countless; numberless; innumerable

かずかぎりなく〔数限り無く〕
〈副〉Without number

かずく〔被く〕
〈他動〉To wear (a hat)

content:
かずける〔被ける〕
〈他動〉To lay (the blame on another); to father (one's child upon another); to affiliate (a fault upon another)

content.content: 自分の子どもを書生にかずけた
He fathered his child upon his house-boy.

かずしれぬ〔数知れぬ〕
〈形〉Countless; numberless; innumerable

かすづけ〔糟漬〕
〈名〉Vegetables pickled in sake-lees

content:
がすとう〔瓦斯灯<ガス灯>〕
〈名〉A gas-light; a gas-lamp

content.content: 露出ガス灯
a gas-jet

content:
がすとう〔瓦斯灯<ガス灯>〕
〈名〉A gas-light; a gas-lamp

content.content: 露出ガス灯
a gas-jet

content:
かずとり〔数取り〕
〈名〉(事)keeping count:(物)counters

content.content: 数取りをする
to keep count (of anything)―(競技なら)―score

content:
かずならぬ〔数ならぬ〕
〈形〉Insignificant; humble

content.content: 数ならぬ身
I am a humble individual.
数ならぬ身とは言えこの場合黙していられぬ
Humble as I am, I can not remain silent on the subject.
数ならぬ身をもって重任を負っている
Though I am a humble individual, I am charged with an important duty.

かずのこ〔数の子〕
〈名〉Herring roe

content:
かすみ〔霞〕
〈名〉
1. Haze; mist

content.content: 山に霞がかかる
The hills are veiled in mist.
遠い山々は霞に包まれている
The distant hills are folded in mist.
景色は霞に隠れて見えぬ
The view is in a haze.
霞棚引く
A haze hangs over the scene―The scene is hazy.
島が霞の中にぼんやり見える
An island shows dimly through the haze.
春霞
a spring haze
花霞
hazy blossoms
雲を霞と逃げ失せた
He fled God knows where.
目の霞
a film over one's eyes―mist

content:
かすむ〔霞む〕
〈自動〉
1. (=霞たなびく)to be hazy
2. (=目がかすむ)to mist; to dim; to be dim

content.content: 今日は目がかすむ
My eyes are dim―My eyes are blurred―today.

content:
かすめる〔掠める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=奪う)to rob (a man of his money); to plunder (a city of its treasure)

content.content: 国をかすめる
to seize on a territory
人の目をかすめて悪事を為す
to do evil in secret―by stealth―on the sly

content: 2. (=擦れ行く)to graze; to glance

content.content: 銃弾が頭をかすめた
A bullet grazed my head.
一弾司令塔をかすめて行く
A shell glanced off the conning-tower.
銃弾が絶えずビュウビュウと耳をかすめた
Bullets whistled past us without intermission.

かすり〔飛白〕
〈名〉A splashed pattern (on cotton or linen cloth)

content:
かすり〔掠り〕
〈名〉Squeeze:(米国にては)graft

content.content: かすりを取る
to squeeze―(米国にては)―take graft

content:
かすりきず〔掠り傷〕
〈名〉A graze; a scratch; an abrasion

content.content: かすり傷を受ける
to get a scratch―sustain an abrasion

content:
かする〔化する〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=変化する)to change, be changed (into something else); to turn, be turned (into something else); to transform, be transformed (into something else); to metamorphose, be metamorphosed (into something else)

content.content: 毛虫が蝶に化す
A caterpillar is metamorphosed into a butterfly.
石に化す
to turn into stone―petrify
欧州は修羅の巷と化した
Europe was turned into a scene of deadly strife and bloodshed.
日本化する
to Japanize―be Japanized
欧化する
to Europeanize―be Europeanized
米化する
to Americanize―be Americanized

content: 2. (=感化する)to influence

content.content: 人の徳に化す
to feel one's influence
全村彼の徳に化せられた
The whole village was influenced by his virtue.

content:
かする〔嫁する〕
〈他動〉
1. To marry, be married to (a man)

content.content: 彼女は二十歳にして田中氏に嫁した
She was married to Mr. Tanaka at twenty.
人に罪を嫁す
One lays the blame upon another.
責任を嫁す
to shift one's responsibility on another's shoulders―shuffle off one's responsibility on another's shoulders

content:
かする〔架する〕
〈他動〉To construct, build, throw (a bridge across or over a river)

content.content: 橋梁を架する
to construct a bridge over a river―build a bridge across a river―throw a bridge over a river―bridge a river

content:
かする〔課する〕
〈他動〉
1. (=税を課す)to lay (a tax on an article); to levy (a tax on an article); to impose (a tax on an article or the people)

content.content: ぜいたく品に重税を課す
Heavy taxes are imposed on articles of luxury.

content: 2. (=負担、課業を課す)to impose (a burden on one); to set (one a task); to give (one a lesson)

content.content: 一週六時間の英語を課す
Six hours a week's English is imposed on the student.
英語を日課として課す
English is given as a daily lesson.
宿題を課す
to set one a home-task

content: 3. (=刑罰を課す)to inflict (a punishment on one); to impose (a penalty on one)

content.content: 罰金を課す
to impose a fine on one―fine one
百円の罰金を課せられた
He was fined 100 yen.
罰俸を課す
to mulct an official of his pay
罰俸一カ月分を課せられた
He was mulcted of a month's salary.

content:
かする〔掠る〕
〈他動〉(=擦れ行く)to graze

content.content: 銃弾が頭をかすった
The bullet grazed my head.

content: 〈自動〉(=掠りを取る)to squeeze:(米国では)to take graft

かする〔和する〕
〈自他動〉

1. A wind:(定まった風は)a breeze:(大風は)a gale; a hurricane:(かすかな風は)a zephyr; a breath of air:(隙間風は)a draught:(ある場合には)air:(風の神は)Aeolus

content.content: 風が吹く
The wind blows―It blows.
昨日は一日風が吹いた
It blew all day yesterday.
大風が吹く
It blows a gale―It blows a hurricane―It blows great guns.
風が吹きすさむ
It blows hard.
風がそよそよと吹く
There is a gentle breeze.
風がそよとも吹かぬ
There is not a breath of air―(陸上なら)―Not a breath of air stirs the leaves―(水上なら)―Not a breath of air stirs the surface of the water.
松吹く風いと淋し
The wind soughs mournfully among the pines.
風が吹き止む
A gale blows itself out.
風が出る
The wind rises―A breeze springs up.
風が静まる
The wind goes down.
風がなぐ
It falls calm.
風が変わる
The wind shifts―The wind veers.
風が東に変わった
The wind has veered to the east.
風が強い
The wind is high―The breeze is fresh.
風が弱い
The wind is light―The wind is low.
風に当たる
to expose oneself to the wind

to expose anything to the air

a blast of wind―a gust of wind

A steamer can run against the wind―in the wind's eye―in the teeth of the wind.
その音が風の便りに聞こえる
The sound comes borne on the wind―comes wafted on the wind.
喬木風強し
The higher the tree, the stronger the wind―“Tall trees catch much wind.”
窓を開けて少し風を入れろ
Open the window, and admit a little air.
冷たい風に当たって正気がついた
The cold air brought me to myself.

What lucky wind has blown you here?―What breeze of fortune has wafted you hither?―What lucky chance has led you here?―To what chance do I owe this visit?―To what business am I indebted for this honour?

content.content: あの人は肩が張っている
He has broad shoulders―square shoulders―He is broad-shouldered―square-shouldered.
肩を張らせる
to square one's shoulders
肩が張った、肩がこった
I have stiff shoulders.
肩がこったら揉ませるがよい
You had better have your shoulders shampooed―have your shoulders massaged.
夏期講習会には肩のこらない読み物が好い
I prefer some light reading for the summer school.
女は肩がこけている
Women have sloping shoulders.
肩をいからす
to perk up one's shoulders
肩をすくめる
to shrug one's shoulders
人の肩をたたく
to slap one on the shoulder
肩を替える
to change shoulders
責任が僕の肩にかかる
The responsibility rests on my shoulders.
肩で風を切る
to swagger
彼は肩で風を切って歩く
He swaggers about.
肩で息を吐く
to breathe with difficulty―gasp for breath
肩をくじく
to strain one's shoulder―wrench one's shoulder
肩を並べる
to rank with―range with―cope with―vie with―compare with―equal―rival―any one
彼は欧米の第一流の学者と肩を並べている
He ranks with―ranges with―takes rank with―the greatest scholars of Europe and America.
彼は三井岩崎と肩を並べる身代になった
He now vies with―copes with―the Mitsuis and Iwasakis in wealth.
英語では彼と肩を並べる人は無い
No one can compare with him in the knowledge of English―He stands unequalled―stands unrivalled―stands unchallenged―in the knowledge of English.
肩を持つ
to side with―take part with―stand up for―take up the cudgel for―espouse the cause of―support―back―favour―any one
僕は弱い方の肩を持つ主義だ
I make it a rule to side with the weaker party.
弟の肩を持つわけではないがお前の方が確かに悪い
I don't mean to take part with your brother, but you are certainly in the wrong.
僕の肩を持ってくれ
You must take my part―support me―back me.
日本は有色人種の肩を持つべきである
Japan ought to stand up for the coloured races.
人が先生を攻撃すると彼はいつも先生の肩を持つ
He always takes up the cudgel for his teacher when any one talks against him.
そうすると支那の肩を持つ国は無くなる
Then no power will espouse the cause of China.
今度の選挙には誰の肩を持つか
Whom will you back in the coming election?
君は現内閣の肩を持つか
Do you favour the present Cabinet?
彼は何かにつけてドイツの肩を持つ
He is pro-German in his sentiments.
肩を入れる
to take interest in―espouse the cause of―support―anything
彼は女子教育に肩を入れている
He takes interest in female education.
政友会がこの政策に肩を入れた
The Seiyukai supported the policy.
近代になって自由のために肩を入れたのは Anglo-Saxon 人種である
The Anglo-Saxons have espoused the cause of liberty in these latter days.
肩を抜く
to cut the concern
肩が軽くなった
I am relieved of my responsibility.

content:
かた〔片〕
〈名〉Disposal; settlement; completion

content.content: 片をつける

to dispose of a matter―get rid of anything―despatch one's business―make an end of one's business―settle a matter―finish one's work―get through with one's task―bring a matter to a termination―bring a matter to a conclusion
片がついた
The matter is disposed of―settled―finished―brought to a termination―brought to a conclusion.

content:
かた〔方〕
〈名〉
1. (=仕方)a way; a manner; how to (do anything)

content.content: 前置詞の使い方
how to use prepositions
箸の持ち方
how to hold your chopsticks
ペンの持ち方が違う
That is not the way to hold your pen.
泳ぎ方を知っているか
Do you know how to swim?
君はやり方が間違っている
You go about it in the wrong way.
歩き方
one's manner of walking―one's gait

content: 2. (=方向)a direction

content.content: 西の方に
in a western direction

content: 3. (=側)a side; a party; a cause

content.content: 敵方
the hostile party
父方の親類、母方の親類
to be related on the paternal side―related on the maternal side
原告方の弁護士だ
He pleads the cause of the plaintiff―appears for the plaintiff.
被告方の弁護士だ
He pleads the cause of the defendant―appears for the defendant.

content: 4. (=何役)the person in charge; the -ing (part)

content.content: 君は煮方、僕は食い方
You do the cooking, and I will do the eating.
会計方
the accountant―the treasurer
(芝居の)道具方
the property man

content: 5. (=誰方寄寓)care of (c/o)

content.content: 手紙を田中方にあてて出せ
Address your letters to the care of Mr. Tanaka.
田中方河田様
Mr. Kawata, c/o Mr. Tanaka.
僕は田中方に居る
I live with Mr. Tanaka.
田中方にお尋ね下さい
Please inquire of Mr. Tanaka.

content: 6. ［敬称］A gentleman; a lady

content.content: その方をお連れになりましたか
Have you brought the gentleman with you?
そういう方は存じません
I do not know the gentleman.
篤子の方
Lady Atsuko.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉By

content.content: 物価は五割方騰貴した
The prices have risen by 50 percent.
あちらの方が二割方安い
They sell cheaper by 20 percent.

content:
がた〔方〕
〈接尾詞〉
1. Towards

content.content: 明け方に
towards daylight
暮方に
towards nightfall―towards sunset
夕方に
towards evening
頃は弥生の末つ方
It was towards the end of March.

content: 2. By

content.content: 米は二円方上がった
Rice has risen by two yen.
十銭方下落する
to fall by ten sen

content:
かたあげ〔肩揚げ〕
〈名〉A tuck at the shoulder

content.content: 肩揚げをする
to tuck in the sleeves (at the shoulders)
肩揚げをおろす
to let out the tucks at the shoulders
まだ肩揚げも取れない娘だ
She is scarcely out of her teens.

content:
かたあし〔片足〕
〈名〉One foot; one leg

content.content: 片足で立つ
to stand on one leg
片足で跳ぶ
to hop
棺桶に片足突込んでいる
He has one foot in the grave.
片足突込んでいながら慾に離れぬ
With one foot in the grave, he can not wean his mind from worldly desires.

かたあて〔肩当て〕
〈名〉A shoulder-pad:(着物の肩当て)a yoke

content:
かたい〔堅い〕
〈形〉
1. Hard

content.content: 堅い木でできている
It is made of hard wood.
この鉛筆は固い
This pencil is too hard.
地面は固く凍っている
The ground is frozen hard.
堅きこと鋼鉄の如し
It is as hard as steel.
金剛石ほど堅い物は無い
Nothing is harder than diamond―No substance surpasses diamond in hardness.
堅くなる
to harden

content: 2. (=硬い)tough; stiff; rigid; stark

content.content: この牛肉は硬い
This beef is tough.
硬い飯
dry rice
死んで硬くなる
to lie stiff in death―lie stark in death―become stark and stiff
彼は硬い文章を書く
He writes a stiff style―a starched style.
相撲が固くなって負ける
A wrestler grows stiff and gets beaten.

content: 3. (=きつい)tight

content.content: この靴はあまり固い
These shoes are too tight.
固く結ぶ
to tie tight
固い結び目
a tight knot

content: 4. (=堅固)strong; firm; solid; sound; steady

content.content: 地盤が固い
The ground is firm.
彼は意志が堅い
He has a strong will―an iron will.
決心が堅い
He is firm in the resolution―His resolution is unshaken.
堅い決心をする
to make a firm resolution―make a sacred resolution
堅い確信を懐いている
He holds a firm conviction.
月日がたつに従って確信が堅くなった
His conviction became firmer will the lapse of time.
要塞は堅くして抜くべからず
The fortress is strong and impregnable.
彼は信用の基礎が堅い
His credit is on a firm basis―on a solid basis―on a sound basis.
冒険をせずに堅くやっていれば無事だ
Run no risks, but keep steady, and you are safe.
彼はばくちを止めて堅くなった
He has given up gambling, and sobered down.

content: 5. (=厳重)strict; rigid; solemn

content.content: 堅い約束をする
to make a solemn promise
あれほど堅く約束をしたのに彼が今日来ないのは不思議だ
After all his solemn promises, his absence today is unaccountable.
あれは堅い人だ
He is a man of strict probity.
身持の堅い人だ
He is a man of strict morals.
うちの親父は堅い
My father is a rigid disciplinarian.
娘は堅い家に奉行している
She lives with a strict family.
そう堅くされてはまことにいたみ入る
You put me to shame by acting so strictly.

content: 6. (=安固)sound

content.content: 利益は無いが堅い商売だ
It is a sound business, though it yields but little profit.

content: 7. (=女の身持の堅い)chaste; virtuous; discreet

content.content: あれは堅い女だ
She is a chaste woman―a virtuous woman―a discreet girl.
どんな堅い女でも彼の手にかかってはかなわない
No virtue is proof against his art.

content:
8. 
〈その他〉

content.content: ばくち打ちは義が堅い
Gamblers have a high sense of honour.
あれは義理の堅い人だ
He is a faithful friend.

content:
かたい〔難い〕
〈形〉Hard; difficult; impossible

content.content: その話は信じ難い
The news is hard to believe―incredible.
あの人は人の言うことを信じ難い
He is hard of belief―incredulous.
英語は入りやすくして極め難し
English is easy to learn, but hard to master.
Emerson の文章は解し難い
Emerson is difficult to understand.
あの人は接近し難い
He is difficult of access.
情慾は制し難い
The passions are hard of control.
好い方法に違いないが実行し難い
It is a good method, to be sure, but difficult to practise.
言うは易く行うは難し
It is easier said than done.
死は易く生は難し
It is easy to die for one's faith; it is hard to live up to it.
この動物は死に難い
The animal is tenacious of life―hard-lived.
人生婦人たるもまた難い哉である
How hard it is to be a woman!

content:
かだい〔課題〕
〈名〉A subject; a theme

content.content: 課題を出す
to give a subject for composition

content:
かだい〔過大〕
〈形〉Excessive; exaggerated

content.content: そんな過大な要求に応ずることはできぬ
I can not comply with such excessive demands.
彼の話は過大で信じられぬ
I can not believe his exaggerated statement―His statement is too exaggerated to be believed.

content:
がたい〔難い〕
〈接尾形容詞〉Hard, difficult, impossible (to do so)

content.content: 良教師は得難い
Good teachers are hard to get―difficult to find.
情慾は制し難し
The passions are hard to control―hard of control.
あの人は接近し難い
He is difficult to approach―hard of access.
願意聞届け難し
It is impossible to grant your petition―Your petition can not be granted.
女子と小人は養い難し
Women and small men are hard to manage.
好い方法には違い無いが、しかし実行し難い
It is a good method, to be sure, but it is hard to practise.
その罪赦し難し
The offence is not to be pardoned―unpardonable.
これは耐え難い、忍び難い
This is intolerable―insufferable―unendurable―unbearable―not to be borne―past bearing―past endurance.
堪え難い取扱い
unbearable treatment―galling treatment
兄たり難く弟たり難し
There is nothing to choose between the two.
曰く言い難し
It is hard to say.

がだい〔画題〕
〈名〉The subject, the motif (of a painting)

content:
かたいき〔肩息〕
〈名〉Gasping for breath

content.content: 肩息を吐く
to gasp for breath
病人はもう肩息になっていた
The invalid was at his last gasp.

content:
かたいじ〔片意地〕
〈形〉
1. (=強情)obstinate; stubborn; obdurate; headstrong
2. (=依怙地)perverse; crabbed; cross-grained

content.content: 片意地を張る
to be perverse―be obstinate

content:
かたいっぽう〔片一方〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: かたほう〔片方〕

content:
かたいなか〔片田舎〕
〈名〉A remote village; an out-of-the-way corner

content.content: こんな片田舎ですから何もご馳走はありません
As we live in such an out-of-the-way corner, you must put up with poor fare.
こんな片田舎に僕を知っている者はいったい誰かしら
I wonder who on earth can know me at this distance from town.

content:
かたうで〔片腕〕
〈名〉
1. One arm
2. (=片腕と頼む人)one's right-hand man; a right arm

content.content: 彼に死なれて片腕を無くなした
I have lost my right arm in him.

content:
かたおもい〔片思い〕
〈名〉Love on one side; one-sided love; unrequited love; unreciprocated affection

content.content: 磯の鮑の片思い
It is love all on one side.

かたおもり〔片重り〕
〈形〉Lopsided (cart or boat)

content:
かたがき〔肩書き〕
〈名〉A title; an addition to one's name; a handle to one's name

content.content: 彼女は博士という肩書に惚れて嫁に行ったのだ
She married him for the sake of his title of doctor.
世間では肩書きよりも実力を重んずるようになった
People have come to value ability above title.
肩書きくらいに驚かない
I do not fear a man because he has a handle to his name.

content:
かたかけ〔肩掛け〕
〈名〉A shawl:(薄い細長いのは)a scarf

content.content: 肩掛けをかける
to wrap oneself in a shawl
女が肩掛けを掛けている
She is wrapped in a shawl.

content:
カタカタ
〈擬音詞〉Clatter

content.content: カタカタ鳴る
to clatter

content:
かたかた〔片々〕
〈名〉One of a pair; the other one; the fellow

content.content: 片々の手に茶碗、片々の手に箸を持つ
You hold the bowl in one hand, and the chopsticks in the other.
片々の靴が無い
I can't find the other shoe―the fellow to this shoe.
双子の片々
a twin brother―a twin sister

content:
かたがた〔旁々〕
〈副〉Partly

content.content: 伊勢へ参詣かたがた見物に行った
I went to see the sights of Ise, partly to worship at the Shrine.
近所へ用達しかたがた彼を訪うた
I called on him, partly as I had business in the neighbourhood.
彼は東京へ商用かたがた遊びに来た
He has come to town partly on commercial business, and partly for pleasure.
これは戒めかたがた言っておく
I tell you this, partly by way of warning.

content:
ガタガタ
〈擬音詞〉Rattle

content.content: 窓がガタガタする
The windows rattle.
風で窓がガタガタする
The wind rattles the windows.
車がガタガタ揺れる
The carriage jolts.
寒くて歯がガタガタする
My teeth chatter with cold.
膝がガタガタふるえる
My knees smite together.
身体がガタガタする
I feel shaky.
家がガタガタする
The house is rickety.
梯子段がガタガタする
The staircase is crazy.
機械などがガタガタになる
A machine gets out of gear.
一つガタガタ来るとこんな家はひとたまりも無い
When there is a strong shock of earthquake, this house will fall at once.

content:
かたがつく〔片が付く〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: かたづく〔片付く〕

かたかな〔片仮名〕
〈名〉The square Japanese syllabary

content:
かたがらす〔片硝子<片ガラス>〕
〈形〉Open-faced (watch)

content.content: 片ガラスの時計
a half-hunter

content:
かたがらす〔片硝子<片ガラス>〕
〈形〉Open-faced (watch)

content.content: 片ガラスの時計
a half-hunter

content:
かたかわ〔片側〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: かたがわ〔片側〕

content:
かたがわ〔片側〕
〈名〉On side

content.content: 道の片側を歩く
to keep to one side of the road
片側通行止
No thoroughfare on one side.
庖丁の片側だけに毒が塗ってあった
The knife was anointed on one side only.

content:
かたき〔仇敵〕
〈名〉An enemy; a foe; a rival; the object of one's vengeance

content.content: 親のかたき
one's father's slayer
親のかたき覚悟致せ
You are my father's slayer. Prepare to die!
親のかたきとつけ狙う
to seek the life of one's father's slayer
親のかたきを討つ
to avenge one's father―avenge one's father's death
四十七士が君のかたきを討った
The Forty-Seven Heroes avenged their lord's death.
きっと君のかたきを討たせる
I will see you avenged.
かたきを取る
take one's revenge―have one's revenge―revenge oneself―get even with one―settle accounts with one―pay one
今度こそかたきを取ってやる
I will have my revenge this time.
かたきを取った
I have my revenge―I have revenged myself―I am revenged―I am even with him.
江戸のかたきを長崎で取る
to pay one off in another coin
犬の糞でかたきを取る
to throw dirt at a man
かたきにめぐり逢う
to come across one's enemy
恋のかたき
a rival in love
二人は商売がたきだ
They are two of a trade.
同業者はかたき同志
“Two of a trade never agree.”
苦労は命のかたき
Care is a foe to life.
金は芸術のかたき
Gold is fatal to art.
主人は僕を目のかたきにして小言を言う
My master finds fault with me whenever he sees me―He never sees me without finding fault with me.

content:
かたぎ〔気質〕
〈名〉Spirit

content.content: 書生気質
a student spirit
商人気質
a sordid spirit
雇人気質
a mercenary spirit
あの人は学者気質だ
He is of a scholarly spirit.
芸人気質だ
He strives after effect.
当世の役人気質はこうしたものだ
Such is officialism nowadays.

content:
かたぎ〔堅気〕
〈名〉Honest life:(=の) honest

content.content: 浮いた家業を止して堅気になった
She has give up her gay profession, and returned to honest life.
足を洗って堅気になった
She has quitted a life of shame, and leads an honest life.
そして堅気な職人のところへ嫁に行った
And she has married an honest workman.
ばくちを止めて堅気になった
He has given up gambling, and lives on the square.
彼女は堅気な家に育った
She was brought up in an honest family.
堅気な女だ
She is an honest woman.

content:
かたきうち〔仇敵討〕
〈名〉A vendetta

content.content: かたき討ちをする
to avenge one's father (or one's lord)―avenge one's father's death (or one's lord's death)

かたきどうし〔仇敵同志〕
〈名〉(They are) enemies, rivals

かたぎぬ〔肩衣〕
〈名〉The shoulder-piece (of the ceremonial dress of the samurai)

content:
かたきやく〔仇敵役〕
〈名〉(=芝居の仇敵役)The villain's part; the r?le of villain

content.content: かたき役をする
to play the villain
あの役者はかたき役が得意だ
He is at his best in the r?le of villain.

content:
かたきゅうくつ〔固窮屈〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: かたくるしい〔固苦しい〕

content:
かたく〔仮託〕
〈名〉A pretence; a pretext; a plea:(=する) to make a pretence of, make a pretext of, make a plea of (illness, etc.)

content.content: 彼は病気に仮託して面会を謝絶した
He declined to see me under pretence of illness―on the pretence of illness―under plea of illness―on the plea of illness.

content:
かたく〔家宅〕
〈名〉A dwelling house; a domicile; premises:(=の) domiciliary

content.content: 家宅捜索
a domiciliary search―a domiciliary visit
家宅を捜索する
to search a house
家宅を捜査しても何も発見せぬ
The house was searched, but nothing was found on the premises.
家宅に侵入する
to trespass on one's premises
家宅侵入
trespass

content:
かたく〔堅く〕
〈副〉
1. (=強固に)firmly; solemnly; positively

content.content: 堅く決心している
I am firmly resolved to do so.
堅く信じている
I am firmly convinced that it is so.
彼は固く取って動かぬ
He stands firm in his opinion.
固く約束する
to make a solemn promise
あれほど固く約束したのに今日来ないのは不思議だ
After all his solemn promises, his absence today is unaccountable.
固くお断わり申す
I positively refuse to do so.
彼は固く辞して仕事を引受けない
He positively declines to undertake the work.

content: 2. (=厳重に)strictly; religiously; conscientiously; scrupulously; to the letter

content.content: 校則は堅く相守るべきこと
The school-regulations must be strictly observed.
この習慣は堅く守っている
The custom is strictly observed―religiously observed―conscientiously observed―scrupulously observed.
ご命令は堅く守ります
Your orders shall be strictly obeyed―obeyed to the letter―Your word shall be law to me.
酒を飲むことを堅く禁じられた
I was strictly forbidden to drink.
車内の喫煙はその筋の命に依り堅くお断り申し候
Smoking in the cars is strictly prohibited by order.
堅く申しつけられた
I was strictly ordered to do so.

content: 3. (=きつく)tight

content.content: 固く口を閉じる
to shut one's mouth tight
門は固く閉じてある
The gate is shut tight.
固く結ぶ
to tie a string tight
固くしばる
to bind a man tight
手拭いを固くしぼる
to wring a towel dry

content:
かたぐ〔傾ぐ〕
〈自動〉To incline; to lean; to cant; to slant; to tilt:(船なら)to list; to careen; to tip; to heel over:(にわかになら)to lurch

content.content: 船が左舷にかたぐ
The ship lists to port.
船がにわかにかたいだ
The ship gave a lurch.

content:

content:

〈名〉
1. (=形状)a shape

content.content: 単葉飛行機はその形鳩に似ている
A monoplane resembles a dove in shape.
遊星の軌道の形は楕円形だ
The orbit of a planet is elliptical in shape.

It is shaped like a cigar.

to get out of shape
帽子の形をくずす
to knock a hat out of shape
形をくずさぬ
to keep anything in shape

content.content: あの人は形は男だが心は女だ
He is a man in form, but a woman in mind.
物質は三つに形を変える
Matter takes three forms.

Like the samurai that he was, he expired without a struggle.

content:
かたづく〔片付く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=整頓する)to be put in order; to be put to rights

content.content: 室内はかたづいている
The room is in good order―Everything is in its place.
家の中はまだかたづかない
The house is still in disorder.

content: 2. (=処置がつく)to be disposed of; to be got rid of; to be got off one's hands

content.content: 第一の問題がかたづいたからこれから第ニの問題に移る
The first question having been disposed of, we now proceed to the second.
仕事がやっとかたづいた
I have got my task off my hands―My task is off my hands.
借金がやっとかたづいた
I have worked off my debts.
在荷はたいがいかたづいた
The stock is mostly disposed of―cleared off.
品物がまだかたづかずにある
The goods still lie on my hands.

content: 3. (=完結する、終結する、解決する)to be finished; to come to an end; to be brought to an end; to be brought to a termination; to be brought to a conclusion; to be settled; to be brought to a settlement

content.content: 事件がかたづいた
The matter is settled.
円満にかたづいた
It has been brought to an amicable settlement.
戦争は今年中にはかたづくまい
I am afraid the war will not come to an end this year.
事件が早くかたづけばよい
I wish the matter would be brought to a speedy conclusion.
事件は首尾好くかたづいた
The matter has been brought to a happy termination.
仕事のかたづき次第行くとそう言ってくれ
Say I am coming as soon as I get through with my task.
今日の仕事がかたづいた
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)―I am through with my day's work―I am through for today.
今日の仕事はあらましかたづいた
I have broken the back of―broken the neck of―my day's work.

content: 4. (=縁づく)to be married (to a man)

content.content: あの娘はどこへかたづいたかね
Whom has she married?
医者へかたづいている
She is married to a physician.
娘どもは皆相応なところへかたづいている
His daughters are all married into respectable families.

content:
かたづける〔片付ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=整頓する)to put (anything) in order; to put (a room) to rights; to put (things) straight; to tidy up (a room)

content.content: 座敷が散らかっているからかたづけよう
I will put the room in order―put the room to rights―tidy up the room.
女中が毎朝僕の部屋をかたづけてくれる
The servant does my room every morning.
顔をかたづける
to prim one's face―compose one's features―compose one's countenance―make up a face

content: 2. (=しまう)to put away (books); to lay away (clothes); to stow away (luggage, etc.)

content.content: 本をかたづけろ
Put away these books!
食卓をかたづけろ
Clear the table!
食器をかたづけろ
Clear away the plates and dishes!―Remove the things!

content: 3. (=処置する、処分する、始末する)to dispose of (a matter); to get rid of (a matter); to get quit of (business); to get (a task) off one's hands; to get (anything) out of the way; to make away with (a man); to make short work of (food or drink)

content.content: 第一の問題がかたづいたからこれから第二の問題に移る
Having disposed of the first question, we now proceed to the second.
店の品をかたづけてしまわねばならぬ
We must dispose of the stock―get rid of the stock―clear off the stock―sell off the stock.
この仕事を早くかたづけたい
I will get quit of this business―get this task off my hands.
この箱が邪魔だからかたづけろ
Get this box out of the way.
彼は邪魔になる奴をかたづけてしまった
He has made away with those who stood in the way.
あの男が来るとビール一ダースくらいたちまちかたづけてしまう
He will make short work of a dozen bottles of beer.
ビール一ダースくらいは僕でもかたづける
I can manage a dozen bottles of beer myself.
借金をかたづけなくちゃならぬ
I must clear off my debts.

content: 4. (=完結する、解決する) to despatch (one's business); to make an end of (one's business); to finish, get through with, be done with (one's task); to get (one's work) finished; to settle (a matter); to bring (a matter) to a settlement; to bring (a matter) to a crisis

content.content: 仕事を急いでかたづけよう
I will despatch my business―make an end of my business―in haste.
この仕事をなるべく早くかたづけたい
I wish to be done with my task as soon as possible.
この仕事を今晩中にかたづけてしまわなければならぬ
I must get my work finished in the course of the evening.
かたづける仕事がある
I have some business to despatch.
仕事をかたづけたらすぐ行く
I am coming as soon as I get through with my task.
今日の仕事をあらましかたづけた
I have broken the back of―broken the neck of―my day's work.
もう今日の仕事をかたづけてしまった
I have finished my day's work―I am through my day's work―I am through for today.
仕事をかたづけてから行くようにしたいものだ
I wish to go with a clean desk.
あの一件をかたづけたかね
Have you settled the matter?―brought the matter to a settlement?
学校騒動を円満にかたづけたいものだ
I wish to bring the school trouble to an amicable settlement.
(この縁談を)まとめるか破談にするかどちらかに早くかたづけたい
The matter must be brought to a crisis.

content: 5. (=縁づける)to dispose of (a daughter) in marriage; to give (a daughter) in marriage; to marry (one's daughter to some one); to marry off (one's daughters)

content.content: 彼は娘をどこへかたづけたか
How has he disposed of his daughter?
彼は娘を医者へかたづけた
He has disposed of his daughter in marriage to a physician―married his daughter to a doctor.
娘を相応なところへかたづけたい
I wish to marry my daughter into a suitable family.

content.content: 刀を抜く

刀をギラリと抜く

刀の鞘を払う

刀の鯉口を切る

刀の錆にする

刀の錆になる

この刀は血を見たことがあるか
Did this sword ever taste blood?
刀にかけて誓う
to swear on one's sword
刀は武士の魂
The sword is the soul of the samurai.
刀の手前黙っていられぬ

刀を売って牛を買う

刀を打つ
to make a sword―forge a sword
この刀は誰の作か

この刀は正宗の作だという

刀傷

刀懸け

刀の刃

刀の鞘

片方の靴はどうした
What has become of the other shoe?―the fellow to this shoe?
片方の手袋が無い
I can not find one of my gloves.
彼は片方の目がつぶれた
He has lost one of his eyes.
片方の話を聞いただけでは裁判ができない
I can not decide on hearing one side of the story―I must “look on both sides of the shield.”

content:
かたほとり〔偏辺〕
〈名〉A corner; a remote corner

content.content: 住居は難波のかたほとり
I dwell in a remote corner of Naniwa town.

content:
かたまり〔塊〕
〈名〉
1. (=固まったもの)a lump; a mass

content.content: 砂糖のかたまり
a lump of sugar
土のかたまり
a clod
血のかたまり
a clot of blood
あの男は慾のかたまりだ
He is a lump of avarice―avarice itself.
宗教はどれも嘘のかたまりだ
Every religion is a mass of falsehoods.

content: 2. (=集団)a group; a knot; a cluster

content.content: ここに一かたまり、あそこに一かたまりになって立っている
They stand in knots.
ここに一かたまりの島がある
Here is a group of islands.
この果物はかたまりになってなる
The fruit grows in clusters.
この花はかたまりになって咲く
The flower blooms in clusters.

content: 3. (=凝り固まり)bigotry

content.content: あの人は仏教の固まりだ
He is a bigoted Buddhist.

content:
かたまる〔固まる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=固くなる)to become hard; to harden

content.content: 糊が固まった
The paste has become hard―hardened.
彼はまだ骨が固まらない
He is still in the gristle.
若い時は頭が固まらない
Young mind is plastic.
雨降って地固まる
“Good comes out of evil.”

content: 2. (=凝結する)to congeal; to coagulate; to curdle; to set

content.content: 膠{にかわ}が固まる
Glue congeals.
卵が固まる
Eggs coagulate.
牛乳が固まる
Milk curdles.
セメントが固まる
Cement sets.
石膏はじきに固まる
Plaster of Paris sets quickly.
彼はまだ頭が固まらない
His character is not set.

content: 3. (=集まる)to gather; to crowd

content.content: 民衆が宮殿の前に固まった
The populace gathered before the palace.
人々がその外人の周囲に固まった
People crowded about the stranger.

content: 4. (=塊になる)to lump; to mass; to cluster

content.content: 粉が固まる
Flour lumps.
軍隊が固まる
Troops mass.
この果物は固まってなる
This fruit grows in clusters.
この花は固まって咲く
This flower blooms in clusters.
竹は固まって生える
The bamboo grows in clumps.
人があちこちに固まっている
People stand in groups.
生徒が三々五々固まって何か相談している
The students are consulting in knots.

content: 5. (=凝り固まる)to be bigoted; to be absorbed (in something); to be engrossed (in something)

content.content: 彼は宗教に固まっている
He is a bigot.
キリスト教に固まっている
He is a bigoted Christian.
学問に固まっている
He is absorbed in his studies.
商売に固まっている
He is engrossed in his profession.
一つ事に固まっている
He is a monomaniac.

content:
6. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 天気が固まった
The weather has settled down―The weather is set fair.
あの人の肺病はもう固まった
His consumption has stopped its progress.

content:
かたみ〔形見〕
〈名〉A memento; a keepsake; a souvenir:(死者の形見)a legacy

content.content: 形見にする
to keep anything as a memento
この品は君に逢った形見にしよう
I will keep the article as a memento of our meeting.
この本は洋行の形見だ
This book is a souvenir of my stay abroad.
何か形見に上げよう
I will give you something as a keepsake.
死んだ伯(叔)父の形見に時計を貰った
I received my uncle's watch as a legacy.
この時計は死んだ伯(叔)父の形見だ
This watch is a legacy from my uncle.
忘れ形見
a child by a departed husband―a posthumous child

content:
かたみ〔肩身〕
〈名〉Prestige

content.content: 肩身が狭い
One feels small―feels mean―feels cheap.
いつまで親の厄介になっているかと思うと肩身が狭い
I feel small when I think I am still dependent on my father.
こんな者が親類中にあるかと思うと肩身が狭い
It is humiliating to think that such a man is my own flesh and blood―I am ashamed of having such relations.
彼は伯(叔)父が高利貸をしているので肩身が狭い
He is ashamed of his uncle being a usurer.
肩身が広い
One can hold up one's head.
戦勝国民は肩身が広い
A victorious nation can hold up its head.

content:
かたみ〔片身〕
〈名〉One side (of a fish)

content.content: 鰹の片身
a side of bonito
魚の片身をおろす
to sliver a fish

content:
かたみち〔片道〕
〈名〉One way

content.content: 片道は歩いて片道は車に乗った
I went on foot and returned by kuruma.
片道切符
a single ticket―a one-way ticket

content:
かたみみ〔片耳〕
〈名〉One ear

content.content: 人の話しを片耳に聞きはさんでおいた
I overhead some one say so.

content:
かたむき〔傾き〕
〈名〉
1. (=傾斜)inclination; slant; slope:(上り坂のは)acclivity:(下り坂のは)declivity:(船のは)list; lurch
2. (=傾向)tendency (to or towards perfection); leaning (towards socialism); trend (of events):(心の傾き)inclination (to good or evil); disposition (to do something); aptitude (to do something); propensity (to some vice)

content.content: 傾きがある
to have a tendency to―tend to―some result―lean towards socialism―to be apt―inclined―disposed―(to do something)
物価は下落の傾きがある
The prices show a downward tendency.
文学は心を上品にする傾きがある
Literature has a tendency to refinement―tends to refine the mind.
徴兵忌避の傾きは近頃無くなった
The tendency to evade conscription has ceased of late.
世人はとかくこの誤りに陥る傾きがある
People are apt to fall into this error.
青年は専門を急ぐ傾きがある
Young men are inclined to―disposed to―rush into their professions.
彼は才子だが軽薄の傾きがある
He is clever, but rather frivolous.
今時の青年は学問を軽視する傾きがある
Young men nowadays are inclined to―apt to―undervalue learning.
世の傾き
the trend of events
輿論の傾き
the trend of public opinion

content: 3. (=性癖)a mental bent; a mental twist; a propensity (to something); a proclivity (to something); a predisposition (to something); a proneness (to something); a bias (toward something); a predilection (for literature, etc.)

content.content: 彼は偽りを言う傾きがある
He has a propensity to lying.
江戸子は御幣をかつぐ傾きがある
Tokyo people have a proclivity to superstition―They are prone to superstition.
名判官は寛大に処分する傾きがある
Great judges have a predisposition to leniency.
物質を重んずる傾きが現代文明の特徴である
A bias toward the material is characteristic of modern civilization.
この少年は文学を好む傾きがある
The boy has a predilection for literature.
あの人は心に傾きがある
He has a mental bent―a mental twist.

content:
かたむく〔傾く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=傾斜する)(前後左右には)to incline; lean:(上下には)to tilt; to cant:(はすには)to slant; to slope:(東西南北には)to incline; to trend:(船は)to careen; to list; to tip; to heel over:(にわかには)to lurch:(日月は)to decline

content.content: 家が傾いている
The house leans to one side―The house is out of the perpendicular.
地震で家が傾いた
The earthquake has made the house lean to one side.
この柱は南の方へ傾いている
The post leans to the south.
塔が傾いて今にも倒れそうだ
The tower is nodding to its fall.
道路がここから西の方に傾いている
The road here inclines toward the west―trends toward the west.
卓子が傾きたがる
The table is apt to tilt over.
道路が緩慢に傾いている
The road slopes gently―The road is a gentle slope.
船は左舷に傾いている
The ship lists to port.
船はにわかに傾いた
The ship gave a sudden lurch.
日は西に傾く
The sun is declining.

content: 2. (=傾向がある)to tend (to or towards some result); to lean (towards something); to trend (towards something); to be inclined (to something); to be disposed (to something)

content.content: 彼の哲学は仏教に傾いている
His philosophy leans towards Buddhism.
天下の輿論は民主主義に傾いている
The public opinion trends towards democracy.
人幸福なればその心自ら慈善に傾く
Happiness will dispose a man to benevolence.
ありていに白状すれば裁判官の心は自ら寛大に傾く
A full confession will incline the judge to leniency.
彼の心は善に傾いている、悪に傾いている
His heart is inclined to good―inclined to evil.
奢侈は亡国に傾く
Luxury tends to ruin a country.

content: 3. (=衰える)to decline; to wane

content.content: 家が不幸に逢って傾いた
The house declined under misfortunes.
家運すでに傾く
His fortunes are on the decline.
繁栄もある点に達すると国の傾くのは自然の勢いだ
On reaching a certain point of prosperity, a nation will decline in the course of nature.
彼の身代が傾いて来た
His fortune is going to wreck―He is going downhill.
運勢傾く
His star is on the wane.

content:
かたむける〔傾ける〕
〈他動〉
1. To incline; to lean; to cant; to slant; to tilt:(船なら)to tip (a boat); to careen (a ship); to heel (a ship) over

content.content: 首を傾ける
to incline one's head―put one's head on one side

content:
2. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 盃を傾ける、一杯傾ける
to drain a cup―have a drink
耳を傾ける
to listen (to a person or his story)
心を傾ける
to bend one's mind to―direct one's attention to―anything
英語の研究に心を傾けた
I directed my attention to the study of English.

content: 3. (=亡ぼす)to ruin

content.content: 国を傾ける
to ruin a country
城を傾ける
to bring a castle to ruin
身代を傾ける
to wreck one's fortune

〈名〉

to strengthen the defences

the fortification of the capital
門々は固めがついている
The gates are manned.

content: 2. (=誓い)a pledge; a vow

content.content: 固めの盃をする
to exchange wine-cups in token of pledge―clench the bargain

to exchange wine-cups in token of marriage-vow

かため〔片目〕
〈名〉One eye

content.content: あの人は片目だ

content:
かためる〔固める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=固くする)to harden (a muscle); to solidify (the foundation); to congeal (glue); to coagulate (an egg); to curdle (milk)

content.content: 筋肉を固める
to harden the muscles
土台を固める

膠を固める
to congeal glue
卵を固める
to coagulate eggs
拳骨を固める
to clench one's fist―double up one's fist

content: 2. (=堅固にする)to strengthen (the defences); to consolidate (the basis); to establish (oneself); to cement (a friendship)

content.content: 基礎を固める
to consolidate the basis

to consolidate the basis of business―establish the business on a firm basis
備えを固める
to strengthen the defences
身を固める
to establish oneself in life―settle down
それから彼は細君を貰って身を固めた
Then he got married and settled down―He settled down to a married life.
このことが二人の情誼を固めた
The event cemented the friendship between the two.
ほぞを固める
to make up one's mind
約束を固める
to make a solemn promise

content: 3. (=塊にする)to mass; to lump

content.content: 軍隊を固める

I will sell the rubbish in a lump.

content: 4. (=防備する)to defend (the country); to fortify (a town); to garrison (a fortress); to man (the posts)

content.content: 国を固める
to defend the country
都を固める
to fortify the capital
城を固める
to garrison a castle
門々を固める
to man the gates
国境を固める
to build forts on the frontier

content.content: 片面だけに書く

〈自動〉

content: 2. (=偏する)to be biassed, be prejudiced (in favour of anything); to be partial (to anything)

content.content: 彼は何の党派にも偏っていない
He is not biassed in favour of any party.

He is partial to things Western.

content.content: 荷があまり片寄っている

content.content: 騙りかと思った
I thought it was an attempt at imposture.
騙りくらいはしかねない奴だ
He is quite capable of obtaining money under false pretences.

content.content: 後世までの語り草になる

content:

content:
かたる〔語る〕
〈自他動〉
1. To talk; to tell; to relate

content.content: 昔を語る
to talk over old times
徴衷を語る

夜を語り明かす
to talk the night away
問うに落ちず語るに落ちる
It is easier to draw than to force.
義太夫を語る
