かたる〔騙る〕
〈他動〉To assume (a name); to personate (a man); to swindle, cheat (one out of one's money); to obtain (money) under false pretences

content.content: 人の名前をかたる
to assume a name―personate a man
彼は僕の名をかたったのだ
He has been assuming my name―posing under my name―personating me.
名をかたって金を取りに来た
He came to obtain money under an assumed name.
金をかたる
to obtain money under false pretences
金をかたられた
I have been swindled out of my money.

content:
かたわ〔片端〕
〈名〉
1. (=不具)deformity; malformation:(不具者)a deformed person; a monstrosity:(=な) deformed; malformed; monstrous

content.content: かたわな子ほど可愛い
A deformed child is all the dearer to its parents.

content: 2. (=廃疾者)a cripple(はいざりなど); a disabled person(は身体の自由を失った人); a maimed person, a mutilated person(は手が一本無い人や鼻の欠けた人など):(=な) cripple; disabled; maimed; multilated

content.content: かたわにする
to cripple―disable―maim―multilate―a person
かたわになる
to be crippled―disabled―maimed―multilated
一生のかたわになる
to become a cripple for life

content: 3. (=不揃いの物)an incomplete set; an odd set; an odd pair:(=な) incomplete; odd

content.content: 一つ離して売ると後がかたわになります
If I sell one, I shall break the set.

content:
かたわきに〔片脇に〕
〈副〉
1. (=一方に)to one side

content.content: この本を片脇に寄せておけ
Gather the books to one side.

content: 2. (=一方の脇の下に)under one arm

content.content: 片脇に本を抱えている
He holds a book under his arm.

content:
かたわら〔傍〕
〈名〉Side

content.content: 傍らに
by the side of―beside―by―a person or thing
戸の傍らに
by the door
窓の傍らに
beside the window
路の傍らに掛茶屋がある
There is a tea-house by the wayside―by the roadside.
人の傍らにすわる
to sit by one
人の傍らに立つ
to stand beside one
人の傍らに寝る
to sleep by one's side
傍らに寄る
to draw to one side―step aside
傍らに人無きが如し
He makes himself at home.

content.content: 学校へ出るかたわら自宅教授をやっている
Besides teaching the school, he gives private lessons at home.
授業のかたわら著述をしている
Besides teaching, he is engaged in writing.

content:
かたわれ〔片割れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=破片)a fragment
2. (=その一人)one of the number

content.content: 彼もかたきの片割れだ
He is one of my enemies.

かたわれづき〔片割れ月〕
〈名〉A half-moon

content:
かたをつける〔片を付ける〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: かたづける〔片付ける〕

content:
かたん〔加担〕
〈名〉
1. (=加盟)participation; complicity:(=する) to participate in, take part in (a scheme); to be concerned in, be implicated in, be involved in (an affair)

content.content: 彼は陰謀に加担した
He took part in the plot―participated in the plot.
疑獄に加担した
He is implicated in the scandal―involved in the scandal.
彼は政府に対する陰謀に加担したというかどをもって捕縛された
He was arrested on a charge of complicity in a plot against the government.
加担者
an accomplice―a conspirator―a confederate

content: 2. (=助力)aid; assistance; support:(=する) to aid; to assist; to support; to countenance; to side with (some one); to take part with (some one); to espouse the cause of (some one)

content.content: 悪事に加担することはできぬ
I can not countenance evil-doing―aid you in doing evil.
敵に加担する
to side with the enemy
彼は革命党に加担した
He espoused the cause of the Revolutionists.

content:
かだん〔果断〕
〈名〉(Prompt) decision; resolution:(=の) decisive; resolute; drastic

content.content: 彼は果断に富んでいる
He has decision of character―a decided character―He is decisive―resolute―a man of decisive character.
果断が無い
He lacks decision―never knows his own mind―He is indecisive―irresolute.
果断な処置をする
to take decisive measures―take drastic measures―take the bull by the horns

かだん〔花壇〕
〈名〉A flower-bed; a parterre; a border

かたんいと〔カタン糸〕
〈名〉Machine cotton

がたんと〔ガタンと〕
〈擬音詞〉(To fall) with a bang

がたんと〔ガタンと〕
〈擬音詞〉(To fall) with a bang

content:
かち〔価値〕
〈名〉
1. (物の価値)value:(人や物の価値)worth:(人や作品の価値)merit:(賞罰などを受ける価値)desert:(世間の価値、評判)estimation

content.content: 金の価値
the value of money
人の価値
a man's worth
本の価値
the merit of a work
価値ある
(人)a worthy man―(物)―a valuable thing―(作)―a work of merit
価値無き
(人)a worthless man―(物)―a valueless thing―(作)―a work of no merit
(いくらの)価値がある
to be worth so much
(何々の)価値あり
to be worth reading―worthy of perusal―to deserve praise or blame―reward or punishment―merit attention
この家は一万円の価値がある
The house is worth 10,000 yen.
この品は値段だけの価値がある
The article is worth its price.
この品は三文の価値もない
The article is valueless―not worth a farthing.
そんな物は鐚{びた}一文の価値も無い
It is not worth a brass farthing.
この本は一読の価値がある
The book is worth reading―worthy of being read―worthy of a perusal―worth while reading―It is worth while to read the book―The book deserves a perusal―deserves to be read.
彼の成功は賞讃の価値がある
His success deserves praise―His success is worthy of praise―deserving of praise.
彼はその賞を受ける価値が無い
He does not deserve the reward―He is unworthy of the reward.
彼の行動は厳罰を受くべき価値がある
His conduct deserves a severe punishment.
そこは行ってみる価値がある
The place is worth a visit―worthy of a visit―worth while visiting―It is worth while to visit the place.
富士登山は十分にその価値がある
The ascent of Mt. Fuji is well worth the trouble.
あの人の演説は聞く価値が無い
He is not worth hearing―unworthy of being heard.
詩人と称すべき価値のある詩人は彼一人だ
He is the only poet worthy of the name.
彼は博士の価値が無い
He is unworthy of the title of doctor.
英語は専門に研究する価値がある
English is worth making a special study of―worthy of being made a special study of―worthy to be made a special study of.
あんな人間は取り合う価値が無い(取るに足らぬ)
Such men are unworthy of notice―beneath notice.
こんな本は批評する価値も無い
The book is beneath criticism.
彼は給料だけの価値がある
He is earning his salary―worth his salt.
給料だけの価値が無い(穀つぶし)
He is not worth his salt.
この事実は注意すべき価値がある
The fact deserves attention―merits attention―The fact is worthy of note―noteworthy.
この発見はなんの価値もない
The discovery is valueless―of no value―destitute of value.
実際上の価値が無い
It is of no practical value―destitute of practical value―practically valueless.
この学問は教育上の価値が無い
The subject is of no educational value―destitute of educational value.
こっけいは変化としての価値あるのみ
The comical is only valuable as a variety.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 青年は元気だけの価値
A young man is nothing if he has no spirits―nothing without his spirits.
軍人は勇気だけの価値
A soldier is nothing if not brave―nothing without his bravery.
富豪は金だけの価値
A millionaire is nothing without his money.
価値が上がる、価値が下がる
to rise in value―fall in value
土地の価値は上がるばかりだ
Land goes on rising in value.
人の価値が上がる、価値が下がる
A man rises in the public estimation―falls ［sinks］ in the public estimation.
彼はこの行動で価値を上げた
He has risen in the public estimation by his conduct―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His conduct has raised him in the public estimation.
彼は今度のことで価値を落とした
He has fallen ［sunk］ in the public estimation by his conduct―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His conduct has lowered ［sunk］ him in the public estimation.
文章が好いから本の価値を上げる(価値を増す)
The beauty of the style adds to the value of the book.
文章が悪いから本の価値を落とす(価値を減ずる)
The badness of the style takes from the value of the work.
僕は人の価値を落とそうとするような精神はもうとう無い
Nothing can be farther from my intentions than to detract from others' merits.
価値を知る、価値を認める
to appreciate anything
世間では彼の価値を認めぬ
He is not appreciated―They deny him justice.
皆この本の価値を認めている
Everybody appreciates the work.
健康の価値は人これを失って始めて知る
People do not know the value of health―the blessing of health―till they lose it.

content:
かち〔勝ち〕
〈名〉A victory; an advantage; a triumph; a conquest; a win; predominance; preponderance

content.content: 勝ちは我れに帰す
The victory remained with us.
競争はこちらの勝ちになった
The competition ended in our victory.
今日はこの方の勝ちだ
The day is ours.
勝負は君の勝ちだ
The game is yours.
得点は三に対し五の勝ち
The scores are 5 to 3 in my favour.
裁判は被告の勝ちとなった
The case was decided in favour of the defendant―The defendant won the case.
勝ちを得る
to gain a victory―win the day―(一局部の勝ちなら)―gain the advantage
勝ちを制す
to prevail over the enemy―get the better of one's rival―get the upper hand of one's man―(議論なら)―have the best of it
勝ちを争う
to strive for victory
勝ちに乗ずる
to follow up an advantage
早いが勝ち
One who does it quickest, wins.
勝ち逃げ
quitting the game when one wins
勝ち手
the winner―the victor
勝ちを占める
to predominate―preponderate―over the others
英国人が勝ちを占めている
The English predominate over the rest.
(学科の中では)英語が勝ちを占めている
English preponderates over the others.

content:
かち〔徒歩〕
〈名〉Walking on foot

content.content: 徒歩で行った
I went on foot―tramped it―trudged it―hoofed it―beat it (on the hoof).
徒歩で河をわたる
to wade across a stream―ford a stream

content:
がち〔雅致〕
〈名〉Taste; elegance

content.content: 雅致がある
to be tasteful―elegant

content:
がち〔勝〕
〈接尾詞〉
1. Apt (to do something); liable (to something)

content.content: 人は誤りがち
Man is liable to error―We are apt to fall into error.
貧乏は学者にありがちだ
Scholars are apt to be poor.
あの人は仕事がおくれがちだ
He is apt to be behindhand with his work.
世人はとかくそう思いがちだ
People are apt to think so―People will think so.
ありがち
to be of common occurrence―of frequent occurrence
そんなことはありがちだ
Such things are of common occurrence―of frequent occurrence―Such things are apt to happen―will happen―There will be such things.
今時分は火事はありがちだ
Fires are frequent―of frequent occurrence―at this time of the year.
けがはありがちだ
Accidents will happen.
これはありがちなことだがこの事件の裏には女がいる
There is a lady in the case, as there will be.
学生にはありがちだが彼はあればあるだけ使ってしまう
He will spend all the money he has, as students will.
詩人にはありがちだが飄然と来たって飄然と去るというのはあの人のことだ
He is here today and away tomorrow, as poets will.
女の子にはありがちのことだが彼女は来た手紙をていねいに保存しておく
She carefully keeps the letters she receives, as girls will.
身体の弱い子どもにはありがちだが彼はたいそう学問にこりたがる
He will fling himself into books, as boys of weak constitution will.
男女間の間違いは若い時はありがちだ
Young people will be indiscreet―Young men will be young men―Young people are apt to fall into error―Youth is liable to error.

content:
3. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: 我れがちに逃げた
It was everybody for himself and devil take the hindmost.
我れがちに席につく
They scramble for the seats.
近頃は不在がちだった
I have been away from home most of the time.
山がちの国
a mountainous country
雨がちの気候
a rainy climate
荒れがちの時候
a stormy season
赤味がちの縞
reddish stripes
黒目がちの目
eyes with a large iris

content:
かちあい〔搗合い〕
〈名〉A clash; a conflict; a collision; interference

content.content: 時間がかち合いになる
The hours clash with each other.
君の計画が僕の計画とかち合いになる
Your plan conflicts with mine―Your plan is in conflict with mine―Your plan interferes with mine.

content:
かちあう〔搗合う〕
〈自動〉To clash with (each other); to conflict with (each other); to collide with (each other); to interfere with (each other)

content.content: 時間がかち合う
The hours clash with each other.
君の計画は僕の計画とかち合っている
Your plan conflicts with mine―Your plan is in conflict with mine―Your plan interferes with mine.
彼我の利益がかち合う
Our interests clash with theirs―Our interests conflict with theirs―Our interests collide with theirs―Our interests run counter to theirs.
会がかち合って一方へ出席すれば一方へ出席することができない
The meetings clash with each other, so that, if I attend one, I can not be present at the other.
祭日が日曜とかち合う
The holiday falls on Sunday.

乾いてカチカチになる
to be dried hard

content.content: こちらが始めからしまいまで勝ち通しだ
We were victorious throughout―We kept the field from first to last―We made a clean score―We left a clean record.

content.content: 勝ち目はどうか、勝ち目があるか

勝ち目がある
The chances are in my favour―(相手を言えば)―I stand a chance against him.
勝ち目が無い
The chances are against me―(相手を言えば)―I stand no chance against him.
勝ち目は七三
The odds are 7 to 3 in my favour.

御一読の上はご火中被下度候
Please commit the letter to the flames after reading it.
校長は身を火中に投じて御真影を出した
The principal plunged into the flames, and rescued the Imperial portrait.

content.content: 花鳥の絵
pictures of birds and flowers

to enjoy nature
花鳥風月を友とする
to commune with nature

the evil of attaching excessive importance to grammar

a gander and a goose

a gosling

〈名〉The (Judo) art of resuscitation

content.content: 活を入れる
to apply the art of resuscitation―resuscitate a man
活を入れて息を吹き返さした
I brought him to life.

content:
かつ〔渇〕
〈名〉Thirst

content.content: 渇を覚える
to feel thirsty
はげしい渇を覚えた
I felt a raging thirst.
渇に苦しむ
to be distressed by thirst―tortured by thirst
渇を訴える
He complains of thirst.
渇をいやす
to quench one's thirst―slake one's thirst

content:
かつ〔且〕
〈副詞、接続詞〉Both... and...; alike... and...; at once... and...; as well as; at the same time

content.content: この本は面白くてかつ為にもなる
The book is both interesting and instructive―alike interesting and instructive―at once interesting and instructive.
彼は勇かつ敏なり
He is both brave and acute―acute as well as brave―as acute as he is brave―no less acute than brave.
彼は才子でかつ勉強家である
He is both talented and industrious―industrious as well as clever―as industrious as he is clever.
彼は英語に長じかつ数学にも長じている
He excels both in English and in mathematics―He excels in mathematics as well as in English.
かつ飲みかつ歌う
He drinks and sings (at the same time).
かつ戦いかつ退く
to cover the retreat

content:
かつ〔勝つ〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=勝利を得る)to conquer (the enemy); to triumph over, prevail over, gain a victory over (the enemy); to get the better of, get the upper hand of, gain the mastery of (the enemy); to win (a battle or a game); to overcome, surmount (a difficulty):(自動詞に用いれば)to win; to gain a victory; to be victorious; to come off victorious; to emerge victorious; to issue a victor; to come off a winner; to have the best of it

content.content: 敵に勝つ
to conquer the enemy―prevail over the enemy―gain a victory over the enemy―gain the mastery of the enemy―get the better of the enemy
日本はロシアに勝った
Japan prevailed over Russia―got the better of Russia.
日本はいつも勝つ
Japan always comes off victorious―comes off a winner.
戦争の始めにはドイツが勝った
Germany was victorious at the beginning of the war.
結局同盟軍が勝った
The Allied Armies won in the end.
戦いに勝つ
to win a battle―win the day
今ひと奮発すれば勝つ
Another effort, and the day is ours.
戦いは強い者が勝つ
The battle is to the strong.
どちらが勝とうが負けようがかまわぬ
I don't care which side may win or lose.
結局実力が勝つ
Real ability wins in the long run.
結局善は悪に勝つ
Virtue triumphs over vice in the end.
邪は正に勝たず
Virtue triumphs over vice.
容易に勝つ
to gain an easy victory―win at a canter
負けて勝つ
to stoop to conquer―gain a moral victory
勝てば官軍
“Might is right.”
勝って兜の緒を締めよ
Do not exult too much in your victory.
君には勝てる見込みが無い
I stand no chance against you.
彼には勝つ見込みが充分ある
I stand a good chance against him.
軍略で勝つ
to outgeneral the enemy
智慧で勝つ
to outwit a man
勝負事に勝つ
to win a game
一番勝った
I have won a game.
三番続けて勝った
I won three times running.
ばくちで勝つ
to win at play
百円勝った
I have won 100 yen from him.
勝ってもしたく負けてもしたくなるものはばくち
Win or lose, one will go on gambling.
競争に勝つ
to win a race
(人生の競争では)着実な者が勝つ
“Slow and steady wins the race.”
競馬に勝つ
to win a race
この馬はいつも勝つ
This house always comes off a winner.
訴訟に勝つ
to win a case
この訴訟は勝てないか
Have you a good case?
困難に勝つ
to overcome a difficulty―surmount a difficulty
どんな困難でも忍耐で勝てぬことは無い
Perseverance will overcome any difficulty―Nothing is so difficult but perseverance can overcome it.
誘惑に勝つ
to resist a temptation
赤誠天に勝つ
Zeal will move Heaven―alter fate―force the event.
病気に勝つ
to get over one's illness
僕には荷が勝ち過ぎている
The task is too much for me―I am unequal to the task.
何で勝つ
to out-
軍略で勝つ
to outgeneral the enemy
議論で勝つ
to outargue one
投票で勝つ
to outvote the other party
おしゃべりで勝つ
to outtalk one
病には勝てぬ
No man is proof against disease.
挙国一致の敵には勝てぬ
There is no fighting against a nation in arms.
時勢には勝てぬ
There is no contending against the spirit of the times.
運命には勝てぬ
It is useless to strive against fate.
主と親には勝てぬ
It is no use kicking against authority.

content: 6. (=勝る)to surpass (the other in some point); to predominate over (the others); to preponderate over (the other); to be superior to (the other); to be ahead of (the others in some respect)

content.content: 彼は英語では全級に勝っている
He surpasses his class in English―He is ahead of his class in English.
砲力では負けるが速力では勝つ
She is inferior to the other in gun-power, but superior in speed.
彼は勇よりも智の方が勝っている
Wisdom predominates over valour in his character.
あの夫婦は細君の方が勝っている
“The gray mare is the better horse.”
気の勝った少年だ
He is a lad of spirit.

洋行したかったが資金欠乏のためにやむをえず割愛した

content:
がっかりする
〈自動〉
1. (=疲れてなら) to be used up; to be done up; to be knocked up; to be dead-beat

content.content: 今日一日授業してがっかりした
I am quite used up―completely done up―dead-beat―with teaching all day.

content: 2. (=失望落胆してなら) to be dejected; to be downcast; to be cast down; to be cut up; to be dashed; to be disheartened; to be dispirited; to be disappointed; to be mortified; one's countenance falls; one's spirits fall

と聞いてがっかり
My spirits fell at the news―His countenance fell on learning that―It is but cold comfort to know that.

content:
かって〔勝手〕
〈名〉
1. (=自分の都合)one's own convenience; one's own pleasure; one's own way; selfishness; wilfulness:(=な) selfish; wilful; self-willed; arbitrary; capricious; whimsical; fanciful; any (one likes):(=に) as one pleases; at one's pleasure; wilfully; of one's own free will; without permission; without leave

content.content: 自分の勝手を図る
to consult one's own convenience
彼は勝手なことばかり言っている
He always consults his own convenience.
勝手なことをする
to do as one pleases―do as one likes―do as one chooses―have one's own way―please oneself
彼は勝手な真似ばかりする
He will have everything his own way―He is self-willed.
勝手にさしておけ
Let him have his way!
ご勝手に遊ばせ
Do as you please!―Please yourself!―Suit yourself!―Much good may it do you!
勝手にし上がれ
Do so and be damned!
去るも留まるもご勝手次第
You may go or stay as you please―at your pleasure―at your sweet pleasure.
君の勝手な時に来て勝手な時に帰ってかまいません
You may come and go any time you like.
服装は勝手たるべし
Any dress may be worn.
誰でも勝手に入る
Any one may enter who chooses to do so―without permission.
買おうと買うまいと僕の勝手だ
I may buy or not as I choose.
わたしの勝手で惚れたのさ
I choose to love him.
そう思うのは僕の勝手さ
I choose to think so.
そう思うなら勝手にそう思うがよい
You are welcome to think so―You are welcome to your opinion.
自分の物は煮て食おうと焼いて食おうと勝手だ
“One may do what one likes with one's own.”
彼は勝手に止めたのだから、こちらは約束を履行する必要は無い
I need not keep my promise, as he has left of his own free will.
彼は勝手な理窟をつける
He explains it in his own way―explains it in an arbitrary manner―gives arbitrary reasons for it―gives whimsical reasons for it―gives capricious reasons for it.
勝手な理窟
arbitrary reasons
勝手に決めた符牒
arbitrary signs
人は勝手なものさ
Men are selfish.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: それが悪けりゃ勝手にしろ
If that is wrong, do your worst!―make the most of it!
ご勝手にお取りなさい
Please help yourself!
私の物は何でもご勝手にお使い下さい
I place my all at your service―I place my all at your disposal―I place my all at your feet.
人の物を勝手に使ってはいかん
You must not make free with others' possessions.
飛入り勝手
Competition open to all!
今度の競走は飛入り勝手だ
The next race is open to outsiders.
世間の人には何とでも勝手に言わしておけ
Let people talk!
君が勝手でしたことだからしかたがない
I can not help what you have done―It is not my fault.
先方で損をするのは勝手だ
If he loses, that is his lookout.
勝手がましいことを申すようだが、ちょうど百円にして下さい
Make it a round hundred, if you don't mind.
細君が家の中を勝手に切りまわしている
His wife carries matters with a high hand.
彼は何事も勝手に決める
He lays down the law.
勝手な熱を吹く
to wag an unbridled tongue
口に税がかからないと思って勝手なことばかり言う
You have an unbridled tongue.

content: 2. (=様子)the state of things

content.content: 勝手を知っている
to know one's way about―know the ins and outs of a matter―know the ropes

Leave the matter to him, for he knows the ins and outs of it.

事務の勝手を呑込む
to get the run of business

content:

content.content: 道理にかなう

名実相かなう

そう言っては文法にかなわぬ

意にかなう

content.content: 金釘流
crabbed handwriting

かなぐし〔金串〕
〈名〉An iron skewer

〈名〉A horseshoe

content.content: 馬に金沓を打つ
to shoe a horse

かなぐりすてる〔かなぐり捨てる〕
〈他動〉To cast off, lay aside (a coat, etc.)

content:
かなぐる
〈他動〉→『

content.content: かなぐりすてる〔かなぐり捨てる〕

content:
かなけ〔金気〕
〈名〉A metallic taste

content.content: この釜は金気が出る
This boiler has a taste.
鍋の金気が抜けた
The pot has lost its taste.
この水は金気がある
This water contains mineral matter.

content:
かなしい〔悲しい〕
〈形〉
1. ［主観的］(=悲しい思いの悲しい)sad; sorrowful

content.content: 初めて故郷を去る時は悲しかった
I felt sad―felt sorrowful―when I left home for the first time.
それを思うと悲しくなる
It makes me sad to think of it―It grieves me to think of it.
もうこれっきり君には会わないと思うと悲しい
It makes me sad to think―It grieves me to think―that I shall never see you again.
悲しいことには彼が死んでおった
To my sorrow,―Sad to say,―I found him dead.
悲しくて泣かずにいられぬ
I can not help crying for very sorrow―I am too sad not to weep.
あまり悲しくてかえって泣けぬ
My sorrow is too deep for tears.
胸が張裂けるほど悲しかった
I felt as if my heart would break.

content: 2. ［客観的］(=悲しい出来事の悲しい)sorrowful (event); sad (news); mournful (occurrence); tragic (event); woeful (experience); doleful (tale); melancholy (autumn scene); pensive (season); plaintive (air); pathetic (story, etc.)

content.content: 悲しい出来事
a sorrowful event―a sad event―a mournful event a tragic event
悲しいしらせが来た
I have received sad news―sorrowful news―mournful news.
皆悲しそうな顔をしておった
Everybody looked sad―looked sorrowful.
悲しい顔
a sad face―a sorrowful countenance
悲しい声で「おさらば」と言った
She said “Farewell” in a mournful voice.
彼女は悲しい境遇にいる
She is in a sad predicament.
秋は悲しい
Autumn is a melancholy season―a pensive season.
狂女が悲しい唄を歌った
The mad woman sang a mournful song―a plaintive air.
悲しいことには彼はますます悪くなるばかりだ
Sad to say, he only grows worse and worse.

content:
かなしいかな〔悲しい哉〕
〈間投詞〉Alas!; Alack!; Alack-a-day!; Ah me!; Woe is me!

content.content: その話は悲しいかな事実だ
The story is but too true.
そのことは悲しいかな知っている
I know it but too well.
悲しいかな彼は悪くなるばかりだ
Sad to say, he only grows worse and worse.

かなしげな〔悲しげな〕
〈形〉Sad; sorrowful; mournful; doleful

かなしげに〔悲しげに〕
〈副〉Sadly; sorrowfully; mournfully; dolefully

content:
かなしさ〔悲しさ〕
〈名〉Sorrow; grief

content.content: 悲しさのあまり何事も打忘れた
In my sorrow, I forgot everything.
あまりの悲しさに目も泣きつぶし
She cried herself blind in her grief.
悲しさ隠す笑い顔
She smiled to conceal her sorrow―She concealed her sorrow by a forced gaiety.
来てみればその人は東の住まいと聞く悲しさ
I found, to my disappointment, that he had gone to the East.

content:
かなしばり〔金縛り〕
〈名〉Binding (one) tight

content.content: 金縛りに縛られる
to be bound tight―(魔法でなら)―be spellbound

content:
かなしみ〔悲み〕
〈名〉
1. (=悲哀)sorrow; grief

content.content: 全国民が悲しみに沈んだ
The whole nation was plunged in grief.
時経れば悲しみも和ぐ
Time blunts the edge of grief.
悦びと悲しみ相半す
I feel mingled joy and sorrow.

content: 2. (=悲嘆)lamentation

content.content: 亡国の悲しみ
lamentation over the country's ruin

content:
かなしむ〔悲しむ〕
〈自他動〉To sorrow (at sad news―over a sad event―for a person) ; to grieve, be grieved (at sad news―over a sad event―for a person) ; to mourn (one's death ―over one's death―for the dead) ; to lament (one's death) ; to deplore (the state of things) ; to regret (one's loss) ; to rue (the hour, etc.)

content.content: 人の死を悲しむ
to lament one's death―mourn over one's death―sorrow over one's death―grieve over one's death―regret one's loss
悲報に接して悲しんだ
I sorrowed at the sad news―grieved as the sad news.
君のために悲しむ
I grieve for you―sorrow for you.
彼らは亡国を悲しむ
They lament their country's ruin.
二人は別れを悲しんだ
They sorrowed at parting.
現代の青年に国家観念の欠乏せるを悲しむ
I deplore the absence of patriotic sentiment in the rising generation of the day.
君に逢ったのを悲しむ
I rue the hour when I met you.
